pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:0.4.eng: The first training rule on expulsion

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.0.1.eng: Homage to the Buddha, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.0.2.eng: At Verañjā: the origin of Monastic Law

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā verañjāyaṃ viharati naḷerupucimandamūle mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Verañjā at the foot of Naḷeru’s Nimba tree with a large Sangha of five hundred monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.1.2.eng: A brahmin in Verañjā was told:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.1.3.pli: “samaṇo khalu bho gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito verañjāyaṃ viharati naḷerupucimandamūle mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.1.3.eng: “Sir, the ascetic Gotama, the Sakyan, who has gone forth from the Sakyan clan, is staying at Verañjā at the foot of Naleru’s Nimba tree with a large sangha of five hundred monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.1.4.pli: Taṃ kho pana bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ evaṃ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.1.4.eng: That good Gotama has a fine reputation:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.1.5.pli: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavā’,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.1.5.eng: ‘He is a Buddha, perfected and fully awakened, complete in insight and conduct, happy, knower of the world, supreme leader of trainable people, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, a Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.1.6.pli: so imaṃ lokaṃ sadevakaṃ samārakaṃ sabrahmakaṃ sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiṃ pajaṃ sadevamanussaṃ sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.1.6.eng: With his own insight he has seen this world with its gods, its lords of death, and its supreme beings, this society with its monastics and brahmins, its gods and humans, and he makes it known to others.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.1.7.pli: so dhammaṃ deseti ādikalyāṇaṃ majjhekalyāṇaṃ pariyosānakalyāṇaṃ sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ; kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ pakāseti;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.1.7.eng: He has a Teaching that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end. It has a true goal and is well articulated. He sets out a perfectly complete and pure spiritual life.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.1.8.pli: sādhu kho pana tathārūpānaṃ arahataṃ dassanaṃ hotī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.1.8.eng: It’s good to see such perfected ones.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.2.1.pli: Atha kho verañjo brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi. Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho verañjo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.2.1.eng: That brahmin then went to the Buddha, exchanged pleasantries with him, sat down, and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.2.3.pli: ‘na samaṇo gotamo brāhmaṇe jiṇṇe vuḍḍhe mahallake addhagate vayoanuppatte abhivādeti vā paccuṭṭheti vā āsanena vā nimantetī’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.2.3.eng: that you don’t bow down to old brahmins, stand up for them, or offer them a seat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.2.4.pli: Tayidaṃ, bho gotama, tatheva? Na hi bhavaṃ gotamo brāhmaṇe jiṇṇe vuḍḍhe mahallake addhagate vayoanuppatte abhivādeti vā paccuṭṭheti vā āsanena vā nimanteti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.2.4.eng: I’ve now seen that this is indeed the case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.2.6.pli: “Nāhaṃ taṃ, brāhmaṇa, passāmi sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya yamahaṃ abhivādeyyaṃ vā paccuṭṭheyyaṃ vā āsanena vā nimanteyyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.2.6.eng: “Brahmin, in the world with its gods, lords of death, and supreme beings, in this society with its monastics and brahmins, its gods and humans, I don’t see anyone I should bow down to, rise up for, or offer a seat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.2.7.pli: Yañhi, brāhmaṇa, tathāgato abhivādeyya vā paccuṭṭheyya vā āsanena vā nimanteyya, muddhāpi tassa vipateyyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.2.7.eng: If I did, their head would explode.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.2.pli: “Atthi khvesa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘arasarūpo samaṇo gotamo’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.2.eng: “There’s a way you could rightly say that I lack taste.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.3.pli: Ye te, brāhmaṇa, rūparasā saddarasā gandharasā rasarasā phoṭṭhabbarasā, te tathāgatassa pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.3.eng: For I’ve abandoned the taste for forms, sounds, smells, flavors, and touches. I’ve cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, eradicated it, and made it incapable of reappearing in the future.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.4.pli: Ayaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘arasarūpo samaṇo gotamo’ti, no ca kho yaṃ tvaṃ sandhāya vadesī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.4.eng: But that’s not what you had in mind.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.6.pli: “Atthi khvesa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘nibbhogo samaṇo gotamo’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.6.eng: “There’s a way you could rightly say that I have no enjoyment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.7.pli: Ye te, brāhmaṇa, rūpabhogā saddabhogā gandhabhogā rasabhogā phoṭṭhabbabhogā, te tathāgatassa pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.7.eng: For I’ve abandoned the enjoyment of forms, sounds, smells, flavors, and touches. I’ve cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, eradicated it, and made it incapable of reappearing in the future.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.8.pli: Ayaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘nibbhogo samaṇo gotamo’ti, no ca kho yaṃ tvaṃ sandhāya vadesī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.8.eng: But that’s not what you had in mind.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.10.pli: “Atthi khvesa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘akiriyavādo samaṇo gotamo’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.10.eng: “There’s a way you could rightly say that I teach inaction.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.11.pli: Ahañhi, brāhmaṇa, akiriyaṃ vadāmi kāyaduccaritassa vacīduccaritassa manoduccaritassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.11.eng: For I teach the non-doing of misconduct by body, speech, and mind.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.12.pli: Anekavihitānaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ akiriyaṃ vadāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.12.eng: I teach the non-doing of the various kinds of bad, unwholesome actions.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.13.pli: Ayaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘akiriyavādo samaṇo gotamo’ti, no ca kho yaṃ tvaṃ sandhāya vadesī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.13.eng: But that’s not what you had in mind.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.15.pli: “Atthi khvesa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘ucchedavādo samaṇo gotamo’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.15.eng: “There’s a way you could rightly say that I’m an annihilationist.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.16.pli: Ahañhi, brāhmaṇa, ucchedaṃ vadāmi rāgassa dosassa mohassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.16.eng: For I teach the annihilation of sensual desire, ill will, and confusion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.17.pli: Anekavihitānaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ ucchedaṃ vadāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.17.eng: I teach the annihilation of the various kinds of bad, unwholesome qualities.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.18.pli: Ayaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘ucchedavādo samaṇo gotamo’ti, no ca kho yaṃ tvaṃ sandhāya vadesī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.18.eng: But that’s not what you had in mind.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.19.comm: The literal meaning is “Good Gotama is disgusted,” but I am taking literary license to make it more meaningful and punchy. Sp 1.7: Puna brāhmaṇo “jigucchati maññe samaṇo gotamo idaṁ vayovuḍḍhānaṁ abhivādanādikulasamudācārakammaṁ, tena taṁ na karotī”ti maññamāno bhagavantaṁ jegucchīti āha, “Again, the brahmin says ‘The Buddha is disgusted’ because he thinks, ‘It seems the ascetic Gotama is disgusted with doing the wholesome actions of bowing down, etc., to elders.’” The brahmin clearly didn’t approve of such conduct, perhaps even finding it disgusting.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.20.pli: “Atthi khvesa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘jegucchī samaṇo gotamo’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.20.eng: “There’s a way you could rightly say that I’m disgusting.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.21.pli: Ahañhi, brāhmaṇa, jigucchāmi kāyaduccaritena vacīduccaritena manoduccaritena.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.21.eng: For I am disgusted by misconduct by body, speech, and mind.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.22.pli: Anekavihitānaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ samāpattiyā jigucchāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.22.eng: I am disgusted by the various kinds of bad, unwholesome qualities.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.23.pli: Ayaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘jegucchī samaṇo gotamo’ti, no ca kho yaṃ tvaṃ sandhāya vadesī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.23.eng: But that’s not what you had in mind.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.25.pli: “Atthi khvesa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘venayiko samaṇo gotamo’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.25.eng: “There’s a way you could rightly say that I’m an exterminator.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.26.pli: Ahañhi, brāhmaṇa, vinayāya dhammaṃ desemi rāgassa dosassa mohassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.26.eng: For I teach the extermination of sensual desire, ill will, and confusion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.27.pli: Anekavihitānaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ vinayāya dhammaṃ desemi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.27.eng: I teach the extermination of the various kinds of bad, unwholesome qualities.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.28.pli: Ayaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘venayiko samaṇo gotamo’ti, no ca kho yaṃ tvaṃ sandhāya vadesī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.28.eng: But that’s not what you had in mind.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.30.pli: “Atthi khvesa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘tapassī samaṇo gotamo’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.30.eng: “There’s a way you could rightly say that I’m austere.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.31.pli: Tapanīyāhaṃ, brāhmaṇa, pāpake akusale dhamme vadāmi, kāyaduccaritaṃ vacīduccaritaṃ manoduccaritaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.31.eng: For I say that bad, unwholesome qualities—misconduct by body, speech, and mind—are to be disciplined.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.32.pli: Yassa kho, brāhmaṇa, tapanīyā pāpakā akusalā dhammā pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā tamahaṃ tapassīti vadāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.32.eng: One who has abandoned them, cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, eradicated them, and made them incapable of reappearing in the future—such a one I call austere.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.33.pli: Tathāgatassa kho, brāhmaṇa, tapanīyā pāpakā akusalā dhammā pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.33.eng: Now I’ve abandoned the bad, unwholesome qualities that are to be disciplined. I’ve cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, eradicated them, and made them incapable of reappearing in the future.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.34.pli: Ayaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘tapassī samaṇo gotamo’ti, no ca kho yaṃ tvaṃ sandhāya vadesī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.34.eng: But that’s not what you had in mind.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.35.comm: “Retiring” renders apagabbha, explained in the commentaries, at Sp 1.10, as: Gabbhato apagatoti apagabbho, “Apagabbha means departed from the womb.” However, there is an alternative, and perhaps more convincing, derivation of this word. According to SED, in Vedic Sanskrit we find the word apagalbha in the meaning “wanting in boldness” or “timid”. It seems possible, then, that we here have a play on words, where the brahmin refers to “timid” whereas the Buddha responds according to the meaning “departed from the womb” or “retired from rebirth”. I have used the word “retiring” in an attempt at catching this pun.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.36.pli: “Atthi khvesa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘apagabbho samaṇo gotamo’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.36.eng: “There’s a way you could rightly say that I’m retiring.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.37.pli: Yassa kho, brāhmaṇa, āyatiṃ gabbhaseyyā punabbhavābhinibbatti pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā tamahaṃ apagabbhoti vadāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.37.eng: For one who has retired from any future conception in a womb, any rebirth in a future life, who has cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, eradicated it, and made it incapable of reappearing in the future—such a one I call retiring.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.38.pli: Tathāgatassa kho, brāhmaṇa, āyatiṃ gabbhaseyyā punabbhavābhinibbatti pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.38.eng: Now I’ve retired from any future conception in a womb, any rebirth in a future life. I’ve cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, eradicated it, and made it incapable of reappearing in the future.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.39.pli: Ayaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘apagabbho samaṇo gotamo’ti, no ca kho yaṃ tvaṃ sandhāya vadesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.3.39.eng: But that’s not what you had in mind.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.4.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, brāhmaṇa, kukkuṭiyā aṇḍāni aṭṭha vā dasa vā dvādasa vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.4.1.eng: Suppose, brahmin, there was a hen with eight, ten, or twelve eggs,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.4.2.pli: Tānassu kukkuṭiyā sammā adhisayitāni sammā pariseditāni sammā paribhāvitāni.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.4.2.eng: which she had properly covered, warmed, and incubated.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.4.3.pli: Yo nu kho tesaṃ kukkuṭacchāpakānaṃ paṭhamataraṃ pādanakhasikhāya vā mukhatuṇḍakena vā aṇḍakosaṃ padāletvā sotthinā abhinibbhijjeyya, kinti svāssa vacanīyo—‘jeṭṭho vā kaniṭṭho vā’”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.4.3.eng: The first chick that hatches safely—after piercing through the eggshell with its claw or its beak—is it to be called the eldest or the youngest?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.4.5.eng: for it’s the eldest among them.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.4.6.pli: “Evameva kho ahaṃ, brāhmaṇa, avijjāgatāya pajāya aṇḍabhūtāya pariyonaddhāya avijjaṇḍakosaṃ padāletvā ekova loke anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddho.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.4.6.eng: “Just so, in this deluded society, enveloped like an egg, I alone in the world have cracked the shell of delusion and reached the supreme full awakening.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.4.7.eng: I, brahmin, am the world’s eldest and best.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.5.1.pli: Āraddhaṃ kho pana me, brāhmaṇa, vīriyaṃ ahosi asallīnaṃ, upaṭṭhitā sati asammuṭṭhā, passaddho kāyo asāraddho, samāhitaṃ cittaṃ ekaggaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.5.1.eng: I was firmly energetic and had clarity of mindfulness; my body was tranquil and my mind stilled and unified.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.5.2.pli: So kho ahaṃ, brāhmaṇa, vivicceva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṃ savicāraṃ vivekajaṃ pītisukhaṃ paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja vihāsiṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.5.2.eng: Fully secluded from the five senses, secluded from unwholesome mental qualities, I entered and remained in the first absorption, which has movement of the mind, as well as the joy and bliss of seclusion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.5.3.pli: Vitakkavicārānaṃ vūpasamā ajjhattaṃ sampasādanaṃ cetaso ekodibhāvaṃ avitakkaṃ avicāraṃ samādhijaṃ pītisukhaṃ dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja vihāsiṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.5.3.eng: Through the stilling of the movement of the mind, I entered and remained in the second absorption, which has internal confidence and unification of mind, as well as the joy and bliss of stillness.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.5.4.pli: Pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca vihāsiṃ sato ca sampajāno, sukhañca kāyena paṭisaṃvedesiṃ, yaṃ taṃ ariyā ācikkhanti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.5.4.eng: Through the fading away of joy, I remained even-minded, mindful, and fully aware, experiencing bliss directly, and I entered and remained in the third absorption of which the noble ones declare:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.5.5.pli: ‘upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī’ti tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja vihāsiṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.5.5.eng: ‘You are even-minded, mindful, and abide in bliss.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.5.6.pli: Sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubbeva somanassadomanassānaṃ atthaṅgamā adukkhamasukhaṃ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṃ catutthaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja vihāsiṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.5.6.eng: Through the abandoning of bliss and pain and the earlier ending of joy and aversion, I entered and remained in the fourth absorption, which has neither pain nor bliss, but consists of purity of mindfulness and even-mindedness.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.6.1.pli: So evaṃ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇāya cittaṃ abhininnāmesiṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.6.1.eng: Then, with my mind stilled, purified, cleansed, flawless, free from defilements, supple, wieldy, steady, and unshakable, I directed it to the knowledge that consists of recollecting past lives.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.6.2.eng: I recollected many past lives, that is,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.6.3.pli: ekampi jātiṃ dvepi jātiyo tissopi jātiyo catassopi jātiyo pañcapi jātiyo dasapi jātiyo vīsampi jātiyo tiṃsampi jātiyo cattālīsampi jātiyo paññāsampi jātiyo jātisatampi, jātisahassampi jātisatasahassampi, anekepi saṃvaṭṭakappe anekepi vivaṭṭakappe anekepi saṃvaṭṭavivaṭṭakappe—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.6.3.eng: one birth, two births, three births, four births, five births, ten births, twenty births, thirty births, forty births, fifty births, a hundred births, a thousand births, a hundred thousand births; many eons of world dissolution, many eons of world evolution, and many eons of both dissolution and evolution. And I knew:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.6.4.pli: ‘amutrāsiṃ evaṃnāmo evaṅgotto evaṃvaṇṇo evamāhāro evaṃsukhadukkhappaṭisaṃvedī evamāyupariyanto;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.6.4.eng: ‘There I had such a name, such a family, such an appearance, such food, such an experience of pleasure and pain, and such a lifespan.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.6.5.eng: Passing away from there, I was reborn elsewhere,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.6.6.pli: tatrāpāsiṃ evaṃnāmo evaṅgotto evaṃvaṇṇo evamāhāro evaṃsukhadukkhappaṭisaṃvedī evamāyupariyanto;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.6.6.eng: and there I had such a name, such a family, such an appearance, such food, such an experience of pleasure and pain, and such a lifespan.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.6.7.eng: Passing away from there, I was reborn here.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.6.8.pli: Iti sākāraṃ sauddesaṃ anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussarāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.6.8.eng: In this way I recollected many past lives with their characteristics and particulars.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.6.9.pli: Ayaṃ kho me, brāhmaṇa, rattiyā paṭhame yāme paṭhamā vijjā adhigatā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.6.9.eng: This was the first true insight, which I attained in the first part of the night.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.6.10.pli: avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā, tamo vihato, āloko uppanno—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.6.10.eng: Delusion was dispelled and true insight arose, darkness was dispelled and light arose,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.6.11.pli: yathā taṃ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.6.11.eng: as happens to one who is heedful, energetic, and diligent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.6.12.pli: Ayaṃ kho me, brāhmaṇa, paṭhamābhinibbhidā ahosi kukkuṭacchāpakasseva aṇḍakosamhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.6.12.eng: This, brahmin, was my first breaking out, like a chick from an eggshell.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.7.1.pli: So evaṃ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte sattānaṃ cutūpapātañāṇāya cittaṃ abhininnāmesiṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.7.1.eng: Then, with my mind stilled, purified, cleansed, flawless, free from defilements, supple, wieldy, steady, and unshakable, I directed it to the knowledge of the passing away and arising of beings.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.7.2.pli: So dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passāmi cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate, yathākammūpage satte pajānāmi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.7.2.eng: With superhuman and purified clairvoyance, I saw beings passing away and getting reborn, inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, gone to good destinations and to bad destinations, and I understood how beings pass on according to their actions:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.7.3.pli: ‘ime vata bhonto sattā kāyaduccaritena samannāgatā vacīduccaritena samannāgatā manoduccaritena samannāgatā ariyānaṃ upavādakā micchādiṭṭhikā micchādiṭṭhikammasamādānā;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.7.3.eng: ‘These beings who engaged in misconduct by body, speech, and mind, who abused the noble ones, who had wrong views and acted accordingly,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.7.4.pli: te kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapannā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.7.4.eng: at the breaking up of the body after death, have been reborn in a lower realm, a bad destination, a world of misery, hell.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.7.5.pli: Ime vā pana bhonto sattā kāyasucaritena samannāgatā vacīsucaritena samannāgatā manosucaritena samannāgatā ariyānaṃ anupavādakā sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhikammasamādānā;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.7.5.eng: But these beings who engaged in good conduct of body, speech, and mind, who did not abuse the noble ones, who held right view and acted accordingly,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.7.6.pli: te kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapannā’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.7.6.eng: at the breaking up of the body after death, have been reborn in a good destination, a heaven world.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.7.7.pli: Iti dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passāmi cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate, yathākammūpage satte pajānāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.7.7.eng: In this way, with superhuman and purified clairvoyance, I saw beings passing away and getting reborn, inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, gone to good destinations and to bad destinations, and I understood how beings pass on according to their actions.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.7.8.pli: Ayaṃ kho me, brāhmaṇa, rattiyā majjhime yāme dutiyā vijjā adhigatā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.7.8.eng: This was the second true insight, which I  attained in the middle part of the night.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.7.9.pli: avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā, tamo vihato, āloko uppanno—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.7.9.eng: Delusion was dispelled and true insight arose, darkness was dispelled and light arose,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.7.10.pli: yathā taṃ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.7.10.eng: as happens to one who is heedful, energetic, and diligent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.7.11.pli: Ayaṃ kho me, brāhmaṇa, dutiyābhinibbhidā ahosi kukkuṭacchāpakasseva aṇḍakosamhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.7.11.eng: This, brahmin, was my second breaking out, like a chick from an eggshell.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.8.1.pli: So evaṃ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte āsavānaṃ khayañāṇāya cittaṃ abhininnāmesiṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.8.1.eng: Then, with my mind stilled, purified, cleansed, flawless, free from defilements, supple, wieldy, steady, and unshakable, I directed it to the knowledge of the ending of the corruptions.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.8.2.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ, ‘ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo’ti yathābhūtaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ, ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ, ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.8.2.eng: I knew according to reality: ‘This is suffering;’ ‘This is the origin of suffering;’ ‘This is the end of suffering;’ ‘This is the path leading to the end of suffering.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.8.3.pli: ‘ime āsavā’ti yathābhūtaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ, ‘ayaṃ āsavasamudayo’ti yathābhūtaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ, ‘ayaṃ āsavanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ, ‘ayaṃ āsavanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.8.3.eng: I knew according to reality: ‘These are the corruptions;’ ‘This is the origin of the corruptions;’ ‘This is the end of the corruptions;’ ‘This is the path leading to the end of the corruptions.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.8.4.pli: Tassa me evaṃ jānato evaṃ passato kāmāsavāpi cittaṃ vimuccittha bhavāsavāpi cittaṃ vimuccittha avijjāsavāpi cittaṃ vimuccittha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.8.4.eng: When I knew and saw this, my mind was freed from the corruption of worldly desire, from the corruption of desire to exist, and from the corruption of delusion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.8.5.eng: When it was freed, I knew it was freed.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.8.6.pli: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti abbhaññāsiṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.8.6.eng: I understood that birth had come to an end, the spiritual life had been fulfilled, the job had been done, there was no further state of existence.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.8.7.pli: Ayaṃ kho me, brāhmaṇa, rattiyā pacchime yāme tatiyā vijjā adhigatā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.8.7.eng: This was the third true insight, which I attained in the last part of the night.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.8.8.pli: avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā, tamo vihato, āloko uppanno—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.8.8.eng: Delusion was dispelled and true insight arose, darkness was dispelled and light arose,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.8.9.pli: yathā taṃ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.8.9.eng: as happens to one who is heedful, energetic, and diligent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.8.10.pli: Ayaṃ kho me, brāhmaṇa, tatiyābhinibbhidā ahosi—kukkuṭacchāpakasseva aṇḍakosamhā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.8.10.eng: This, brahmin, was my third breaking out, like a chick from an eggshell.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.9.1.pli: Evaṃ vutte, verañjo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.9.1.eng: That brahmin then said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.9.2.eng: “Good Gotama is the eldest! Good Gotama is the best!

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.9.3.pli: Abhikkantaṃ, bho gotama, abhikkantaṃ, bho gotama.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.9.4.pli: Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya—‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.9.4.eng: Just as one might set upright what’s overturned, or reveal what’s hidden, or show the way to one who’s lost, or bring a lamp into the dark so that one with eyes might see what’s there—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.9.5.pli: evamevaṃ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.9.5.eng: just so has the Buddha made the Teaching clear in many ways.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.9.6.pli: Esāhaṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.9.6.eng: Good Gotama, I go for refuge to the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.9.7.pli: Upāsakaṃ maṃ bhavaṃ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gataṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.9.7.eng: Please accept me as a lay follower who’s gone for refuge for life.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.9.8.pli: Adhivāsetu ca me bhavaṃ gotamo verañjāyaṃ vassāvāsaṃ saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.9.8.eng: And please consent to spend the rainy-season residence at Verañjā together with the Sangha of monks.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.9.9.eng: The Buddha consented by keeping silent, and the brahmin understood.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.9.10.pli: Atha kho verañjo brāhmaṇo bhagavato adhivāsanaṃ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.9.10.eng: He then got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena verañjā dubbhikkhā hoti dvīhitikā setaṭṭhikā salākāvuttā na sukarā uñchena paggahena yāpetuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.1.eng: At that time Verañjā was short of food and afflicted with hunger, with crops affected by whiteheads and turned to straw. It was not easy to get by on almsfood.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.1.comm: “Whiteheads” renders setaṭṭ(h)ikā, literally, “white bones”. Sp 4.403: Setaṭṭhikā nāma rogajātīti eko pāṇako nāḷimajjhagataṁ kaṇḍaṁ vijjhati, yena viddhattā nikkhantampi sālisīsaṁ khīraṁ gahetuṁ na sakkoti, “The disease called setaṭṭhikā means: an insect penetrates the stem, goes to the middle of the stalk, from the penetration of which the rice grains are not able to get sap.” This seems to be a description of so-called “whiteheads”, pale panicles without rice grains, caused by stem borers.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena uttarāpathakā assavāṇijā pañcamattehi assasatehi verañjaṃ vassāvāsaṃ upagatā honti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.2.eng: Just then some horse dealers from Uttarāpatha had entered the rainy-season residence at Verañjā with five hundred horses.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.3.pli: Tehi assamaṇḍalikāsu bhikkhūnaṃ patthapatthapulakaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.3.eng: In the horse pen they prepared portion upon portion of steamed grain for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.4.pli: Bhikkhū pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya verañjaṃ piṇḍāya pavisitvā piṇḍaṃ alabhamānā assamaṇḍalikāsu piṇḍāya caritvā patthapatthapulakaṃ ārāmaṃ āharitvā udukkhale koṭṭetvā koṭṭetvā paribhuñjanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.4.eng: Then, after robing up in the morning, the monks took their bowls and robes and entered Verañjā for alms. Not getting anything, they went to the horse pen. They then brought back many portions of steamed grain to the monastery, where they pounded and ate them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.5.pli: Āyasmā panānando patthapulakaṃ silāyaṃ pisitvā bhagavato upanāmeti. Taṃ bhagavā paribhuñjati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.5.eng: Venerable Ānanda crushed a portion on a stone, took it to the Buddha, and the Buddha ate it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.6.eng: And the Buddha heard the sound of the mortar.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.7.pli: Jānantāpi tathāgatā pucchanti, jānantāpi na pucchanti;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.7.eng: When Buddhas know what is going on, sometimes they ask and sometimes not.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.8.pli: kālaṃ viditvā pucchanti, kālaṃ viditvā na pucchanti;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.8.eng: They know the right time to ask and when not to ask.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.9.eng: Buddhas ask when it is beneficial, otherwise not,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.10.eng: for Buddhas are incapable of doing what is unbeneficial.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.10.comm: “Incapable of doing” renders setughāta, literally, “destroyed the bridge”. Sp 1.16: Setu vuccati maggo, maggeneva tādisassa vacanassa ghāto, samucchedoti vuttaṁ hoti, “The path is called the bridge. What is said is that there is the destruction and cutting off of such speech by the path.” The commentary seems to take setu, “bridge”, as a reference to the eightfold path. According to this understanding, the Buddha has cut off access to bad qualities, including bad speech, by fulfilling the eightfold path. I prefer to understand “bridge” as a metaphor for access, that is, the Buddhas no longer have access to what is unbeneficial.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.11.pli: Dvīhi ākārehi buddhā bhagavanto bhikkhū paṭipucchanti— dhammaṃ vā desessāma, sāvakānaṃ vā sikkhāpadaṃ paññapessāmāti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.11.eng: Buddhas question the monks for two reasons: to give a teaching or to lay down a training rule.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.12.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesi—“kiṃ nu kho so, ānanda, udukkhalasaddo”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.12.eng: And so he said to Ānanda, “Ānanda, what’s this sound of a mortar?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.13.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.13.eng: Ānanda told him what was happening.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.15.pli: Tumhehi, ānanda, sappurisehi vijitaṃ. Pacchimā janatā sālimaṃsodanaṃ atimaññissatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.15.eng: You’re all superior people who have conquered the problems of famine. Later generations will despise even meat and rice.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.1.15.comm: I have supplied “the problems of famine” from the commentary to bring out the meaning. Sp 1.16: Dubbhikkhe dullabhapiṇḍe imāya sallahukavuttitāya iminā ca sallekhena vijitaṁ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.2.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.2.1.eng: Then Venerable Mahāmoggallāna went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down, and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.2.2.pli: “etarahi, bhante, verañjā dubbhikkhā dvīhitikā setaṭṭhikā salākāvuttā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.2.2.eng: “At present, sir, Verañjā is short of food and afflicted with hunger, with crops affected by whiteheads and turned to straw.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.2.3.eng: It’s not easy to get by on almsfood.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.2.4.pli: Imissā, bhante, mahāpathaviyā heṭṭhimatalaṃ sampannaṃ—seyyathāpi khuddamadhuṃ anīlakaṃ; evamassādaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.2.4.eng: But the undersurface of this great earth abounds with food, tasting just like pure honey.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.2.5.pli: Sādhāhaṃ, bhante, pathaviṃ parivatteyyaṃ. Bhikkhū pappaṭakojaṃ paribhuñjissantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.2.5.eng: Would it be good, sir, if I inverted the earth so that the monks may enjoy the nutrition in that ground-fungus?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.2.5.comm: Sp 1.17: Ettha sādhūti āyācanavacanametaṁ, “Here this sādhu is expressing a question.” And the same below. Pappaṭaka, according to DN 27, is a kind of mushroom.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.2.6.pli: “Ye pana te, moggallāna, pathavinissitā pāṇā te kathaṃ karissasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.2.6.eng: “But what will you do, Moggallāna, with the creatures that live there?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.2.7.pli: “Ekāhaṃ, bhante, pāṇiṃ abhinimminissāmi—seyyathāpi mahāpathavī. Ye pathavinissitā pāṇā te tattha saṅkāmessāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.2.7.eng: “I’ll transform one hand to be like the great earth and make those creatures go there.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.2.8.eng: I’ll then invert the earth with the other hand.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.2.9.pli: “Alaṃ, moggallāna, mā te rucci pathaviṃ parivattetuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.2.9.eng: “Let it be, Moggallāna, don’t invert the earth.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.2.10.eng: Those creatures might lose their minds.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.2.11.pli: “Sādhu, bhante, sabbo bhikkhusaṅgho uttarakuruṃ piṇḍāya gaccheyyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.2.11.eng: “In that case, sir, would it be good if the whole Sangha of monks could go to Uttarakuru for alms?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.2.12.pli: “Alaṃ, moggallāna, mā te rucci sabbassa bhikkhusaṅghassa uttarakuruṃ piṇḍāya gamanan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:2.2.12.eng: “Let it be, Moggallāna, don’t pursue this.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.1.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmato sāriputtassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.1.1.eng: Soon afterwards, while reflecting in private, Venerable Sāriputta thought,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.1.2.pli: “katamesānaṃ kho buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ brahmacariyaṃ na ciraṭṭhitikaṃ ahosi;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.1.2.eng: “Which Buddhas had a long-lasting spiritual life, and which not?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.1.3.pli: katamesānaṃ buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ brahmacariyaṃ ciraṭṭhitikaṃ ahosī”ti?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.1.4.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā sāriputto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.1.4.eng: In the evening, after coming out of seclusion, Sāriputta went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down, and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.1.5.pli: “idha mayhaṃ, bhante, rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.1.5.eng: “Just now, sir, while I was reflecting in private, I was wondering which Buddhas had a long-lasting spiritual life, and which not?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.1.6.pli: ‘katamesānaṃ kho buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ brahmacariyaṃ na ciraṭṭhitikaṃ ahosi, katamesānaṃ buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ brahmacariyaṃ ciraṭṭhitikaṃ ahosī’ti. Katamesānaṃ nu kho, bhante, buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ brahmacariyaṃ na ciraṭṭhitikaṃ ahosi, katamesānaṃ buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ brahmacariyaṃ ciraṭṭhitikaṃ ahosī”ti?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.1.7.pli: “Bhagavato ca, sāriputta, vipassissa bhagavato ca sikhissa bhagavato ca vessabhussa brahmacariyaṃ na ciraṭṭhitikaṃ ahosi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.1.7.eng: “Sāriputta, the spiritual life established by the Buddhas Vipassī, Sikhī, and Vessabhū didn’t last long.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.1.8.pli: Bhagavato ca, sāriputta, kakusandhassa bhagavato ca koṇāgamanassa bhagavato ca kassapassa brahmacariyaṃ ciraṭṭhitikaṃ ahosī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.1.8.eng: But the spiritual life established by the Buddhas Kakusandha, Konāgamana, and Kassapa did.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.2.1.pli: “Ko nu kho, bhante, hetu ko paccayo, yena bhagavato ca vipassissa bhagavato ca sikhissa bhagavato ca vessabhussa brahmacariyaṃ na ciraṭṭhitikaṃ ahosī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.2.1.eng: “And why did the spiritual life established by the former three Buddhas not last long?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.2.2.pli: “Bhagavā ca, sāriputta, vipassī bhagavā ca sikhī bhagavā ca vessabhū kilāsuno ahesuṃ sāvakānaṃ vitthārena dhammaṃ desetuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.2.2.eng: “They made no effort to give detailed teachings to their disciples.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.2.3.pli: Appakañca nesaṃ ahosi suttaṃ geyyaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ gāthā udānaṃ itivuttakaṃ jātakaṃ abbhutadhammaṃ vedallaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.2.3.eng: They gave few discourses in prose or in mixed prose and verse; few expositions, verses, heartfelt exclamations, quotations, birth stories, amazing accounts, and analyses.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.2.4.eng: Nor did they lay down training rules or recite a monastic code.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.2.5.pli: Tesaṃ buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ antaradhānena buddhānubuddhānaṃ sāvakānaṃ antaradhānena ye te pacchimā sāvakā nānānāmā nānāgottā nānājaccā nānākulā pabbajitā te taṃ brahmacariyaṃ khippaññeva antaradhāpesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.2.5.eng: After the disappearance of those Buddhas and the disciples awakened under them, those who were the last disciples—of various names, families, and castes, who had gone forth from various households—allowed that spiritual life to disappear rapidly.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.2.6.pli: Seyyathāpi, sāriputta, nānāpupphāni phalake nikkhittāni suttena asaṅgahitāni tāni vāto vikirati vidhamati viddhaṃseti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.2.6.eng: It’s like flowers on a wooden plank. If they’re not held together with a string, they’re scattered about, whirled about, and destroyed by the wind.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.2.8.eng: Because they’re not held together with a string.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.2.9.pli: Evameva kho, sāriputta, tesaṃ buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ antaradhānena buddhānubuddhānaṃ sāvakānaṃ antaradhānena ye te pacchimā sāvakā nānānāmā nānāgottā nānājaccā nānākulā pabbajitā te taṃ brahmacariyaṃ khippaññeva antaradhāpesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.2.9.eng: Just so, after the disappearance of those Buddhas and the disciples awakened under them, those who were the last disciples allowed that spiritual life to disappear rapidly.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.2.10.pli: Akilāsuno ca te bhagavanto ahesuṃ sāvake cetasā ceto paricca ovadituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.2.10.eng: Instead they were untiring at instructing their disciples by reading their minds.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.2.11.pli: Bhūtapubbaṃ, sāriputta, vessabhū bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho aññatarasmiṃ bhiṃsanake vanasaṇḍe sahassaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ cetasā ceto paricca ovadati anusāsati—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.2.11.eng: At one time, Sāriputta, the Buddha Vessabhū, the Perfected and the fully Awakened One, was staying in a certain frightening forest grove. He instructed a sangha of a thousand monks by reading their minds, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.2.13.eng: pay attention like this, not like that;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.2.15.pli: Atha kho, sāriputta, tassa bhikkhusahassassa vessabhunā bhagavatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena evaṃ ovadiyamānānaṃ evaṃ anusāsiyamānānaṃ anupādāya āsavehi cittāni vimucciṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.2.15.eng: When they had been instructed by Buddha Vessabhū, their minds were freed from the corruptions through letting go.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.2.16.pli: Tatra sudaṃ, sāriputta, bhiṃsanakassa vanasaṇḍassa bhiṃsanakatasmiṃ hoti—yo koci avītarāgo taṃ vanasaṇḍaṃ pavisati, yebhuyyena lomāni haṃsanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.2.16.eng: But if anyone with sensual desire entered that frightening forest grove, they usually had goosebumps all over.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.2.17.pli: Ayaṃ kho, sāriputta, hetu ayaṃ paccayo yena bhagavato ca vipassissa bhagavato ca sikhissa bhagavato ca vessabhussa brahmacariyaṃ na ciraṭṭhitikaṃ ahosī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.2.17.eng: This is why the spiritual life established by those Buddhas did not last long.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.3.1.pli: “Ko pana, bhante, hetu ko paccayo yena bhagavato ca kakusandhassa bhagavato ca koṇāgamanassa bhagavato ca kassapassa brahmacariyaṃ ciraṭṭhitikaṃ ahosī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.3.1.eng: “Why then did the spiritual life established by the latter three Buddhas last long?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.3.2.pli: “Bhagavā ca, sāriputta, kakusandho bhagavā ca koṇāgamano bhagavā ca kassapo akilāsuno ahesuṃ sāvakānaṃ vitthārena dhammaṃ desetuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.3.2.eng: “The Buddhas Kakusandha, Konāgamana, and Kassapa were untiring in giving detailed teachings to their disciples.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.3.3.pli: Bahuñca nesaṃ ahosi suttaṃ geyyaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ gāthā udānaṃ itivuttakaṃ jātakaṃ abbhutadhammaṃ vedallaṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.3.3.eng: They gave many discourses in prose and in mixed prose and verse; many expositions, verses, heartfelt exclamations, quotations, birth stories, amazing accounts, and analyses.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.3.4.eng: And they laid down training rules and recited a monastic code.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.3.5.pli: Tesaṃ buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ antaradhānena buddhānubuddhānaṃ sāvakānaṃ antaradhānena ye te pacchimā sāvakā nānānāmā nānāgottā nānājaccā nānākulā pabbajitā te taṃ brahmacariyaṃ ciraṃ dīghamaddhānaṃ ṭhapesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.3.5.eng: After the disappearance of those Buddhas and the disciples awakened under them, those who were the last disciples—of various names, families, and castes, who had gone forth from various households—made that spiritual life last for a long time.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.3.6.pli: Seyyathāpi, sāriputta, nānāpupphāni phalake nikkhittāni suttena susaṅgahitāni, tāni vāto na vikirati na vidhamati na viddhaṃseti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.3.6.eng: It’s like flowers on a wooden plank. If they’re held together with a string, they’re not scattered about, whirled about, or destroyed by the wind.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.3.8.eng: Because they are held together with a string.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.3.9.pli: Evameva kho, sāriputta, tesaṃ buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ antaradhānena buddhānubuddhānaṃ sāvakānaṃ antaradhānena ye te pacchimā sāvakā nānānāmā nānāgottā nānājaccā nānākulā pabbajitā te taṃ brahmacariyaṃ ciraṃ dīghamaddhānaṃ ṭhapesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.3.9.eng: Just so, after the disappearance of those Buddhas and the disciples awakened under them, those who were the last disciples made that spiritual life last for a long time.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.3.10.pli: Ayaṃ kho, sāriputta, hetu ayaṃ paccayo yena bhagavato ca kakusandhassa bhagavato ca koṇāgamanassa bhagavato ca kassapassa brahmacariyaṃ ciraṭṭhitikaṃ ahosī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.3.10.eng: This is why the spiritual life established by those Buddhas lasted long.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.4.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto uṭṭhāyāsanā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā tenañjaliṃ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.4.1.eng: Sāriputta then got up from his seat, arranged his upper robe over one shoulder, raised his joined palms, and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.4.3.pli: Yaṃ bhagavā sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññapeyya, uddiseyya pātimokkhaṃ, yathayidaṃ brahmacariyaṃ addhaniyaṃ assa ciraṭṭhitikan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.4.3.eng: for laying down training rules and reciting a monastic code, so that this spiritual life may last for a long time.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.4.5.eng: The Buddha knows the appropriate time for this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.4.6.pli: Na tāva, sāriputta, satthā sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññapeti uddisati pātimokkhaṃ yāva na idhekacce āsavaṭṭhānīyā dhammā saṅghe pātubhavanti. Yato ca kho, sāriputta, idhekacce āsavaṭṭhānīyā dhammā saṅghe pātubhavanti, atha satthā sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññapeti uddisati pātimokkhaṃ tesaṃyeva āsavaṭṭhānīyānaṃ dhammānaṃ paṭighātāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.4.6.eng: The Teacher doesn’t lay down training rules or recite a monastic code until the causes of corruption appear in the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.4.7.pli: Na tāva, sāriputta, idhekacce āsavaṭṭhānīyā dhammā saṅghe pātubhavanti yāva na saṅgho rattaññumahattaṃ patto hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.4.7.eng: And they don’t appear until the Sangha has attained long standing,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.4.8.pli: Yato ca kho, sāriputta, saṅgho rattaññumahattaṃ patto hoti atha idhekacce āsavaṭṭhānīyā dhammā saṅghe pātubhavanti, atha satthā sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññapeti uddisati pātimokkhaṃ tesaṃyeva āsavaṭṭhānīyānaṃ dhammānaṃ paṭighātāya.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.4.9.pli: Na tāva, sāriputta, idhekacce āsavaṭṭhānīyā dhammā saṅghe pātubhavanti, yāva na saṅgho vepullamahattaṃ patto hoti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.4.10.pli: Yato ca kho, sāriputta, saṅgho vepullamahattaṃ patto hoti, atha idhekacce āsavaṭṭhānīyā dhammā saṅghe pātubhavanti, atha satthā sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññapeti uddisati pātimokkhaṃ tesaṃyeva āsavaṭṭhānīyānaṃ dhammānaṃ paṭighātāya.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.4.11.pli: Na tāva, sāriputta, idhekacce āsavaṭṭhānīyā dhammā saṅghe pātubhavanti, yāva na saṅgho lābhaggamahattaṃ patto hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.4.11.eng: an abundance of the best material support,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.4.12.pli: Yato ca kho, sāriputta, saṅgho lābhaggamahattaṃ patto hoti, atha idhekacce āsavaṭṭhānīyā dhammā saṅghe pātubhavanti, atha satthā sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññapeti uddisati pātimokkhaṃ tesaṃyeva āsavaṭṭhānīyānaṃ dhammānaṃ paṭighātāya.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.4.13.pli: Na tāva, sāriputta, idhekacce āsavaṭṭhānīyā dhammā saṅghe pātubhavanti, yāva na saṅgho bāhusaccamahattaṃ patto hoti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.4.14.pli: Yato ca kho, sāriputta, saṅgho bāhusaccamahattaṃ patto hoti, atha idhekacce āsavaṭṭhānīyā dhammā saṅghe pātubhavanti, atha satthā sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññapeti uddisati pātimokkhaṃ tesaṃyeva āsavaṭṭhānīyānaṃ dhammānaṃ paṭighātāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.4.14.eng: When the causes of corruption appear for any of these reasons, then the Teacher lays down training rules for his disciples and recites a monastic code in order to counteract these causes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.4.15.pli: Nirabbudo hi, sāriputta, bhikkhusaṅgho nirādīnavo apagatakāḷako suddho sāre patiṭṭhito.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.4.15.eng: Sāriputta, the Sangha of monks is free from cancer and danger, stainless, pure, and established in the essence.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.4.16.pli: Imesañhi, sāriputta, pañcannaṃ bhikkhusatānaṃ yo pacchimako bhikkhu so sotāpanno avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:3.4.16.eng: Even the least developed of these five hundred monks is a stream-enterer. They will not be reborn in the lower world, but are fixed in destiny and bound for awakening.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesi—“āciṇṇaṃ kho panetaṃ, ānanda, tathāgatānaṃ yehi nimantitā vassaṃ vasanti, na te anapaloketvā janapadacārikaṃ pakkamanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.1.eng: Then the Buddha said to Ānanda, “Ānanda, it’s the custom for Buddhas not to go wandering the country without taking leave of those who invited them to spend the rainy-season residence.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.2.eng: Let’s go to the brahmin of Verañjā and take leave.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.3.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavā nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya āyasmatā ānandena pacchāsamaṇena yena verañjassa brāhmaṇassa nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.4.eng: The Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe and, with Ānanda as his attendant, went to that brahmin’s house where he sat down on the prepared seat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.5.pli: Atha kho verañjo brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.5.eng: The brahmin approached the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.6.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho verañjaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ bhagavā etadavoca—“nimantitamha tayā, brāhmaṇa, vassaṃvuṭṭhā, apalokema taṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.6.eng: And the Buddha said, “Brahmin, we’ve completed the rains residence according to your invitation, and now we take leave of you.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.7.eng: We wish to depart to wander the country.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.8.pli: “Saccaṃ, bho gotama, nimantitattha mayā vassaṃvuṭṭhā; api ca yo deyyadhammo so na dinno.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.8.eng: “It’s true, good Gotama, that you’ve completed the rains residence according to my invitation, but I haven’t given anything.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.10.pli: nopi adātukamyatā, taṃ kutettha labbhā bahukiccā gharāvāsā bahukaraṇīyā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.10.eng: It’s not because I didn’t want to, but because household life is so busy.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.11.pli: Adhivāsetu me bhavaṃ gotamo svātanāya bhattaṃ saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.11.eng: Would you and the Sangha of monks please accept a meal from me tomorrow?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.12.eng: The Buddha consented by keeping silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.13.pli: Atha kho bhagavā verañjaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.13.eng: Then, after instructing, inspiring, and gladdening that brahmin with a teaching, the Buddha got up from his seat and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.14.pli: Atha kho verañjo brāhmaṇo tassā rattiyā accayena sake nivesane paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṃ ārocāpesi—“kālo, bho gotama, niṭṭhitaṃ bhattan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.14.eng: The following morning the brahmin prepared various kinds of fine foods in his own house and then had the Buddha informed that the meal was ready.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.15.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena verañjassa brāhmaṇassa nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghena.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.15.eng: The Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe and, together with the Sangha of monks, he went to that brahmin’s house where he sat down on the prepared seat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.16.pli: Atha kho verañjo brāhmaṇo buddhappamukhaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā bhagavantaṃ bhuttāviṃ onītapattapāṇiṃ ticīvarena acchādesi, ekamekañca bhikkhuṃ ekamekena dussayugena acchādesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.16.eng: And that brahmin personally served and satisfied the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha with various kinds of fine foods. When the Buddha had finished his meal, the brahmin gave him a set of three robes and to each monk two pieces of cloth.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.17.pli: Atha kho bhagavā verañjaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.17.eng: The Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching, and then got up from his seat and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.18.pli: Atha kho bhagavā verañjāyaṃ yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā anupagamma soreyyaṃ saṅkassaṃ kaṇṇakujjaṃ yena payāgapatiṭṭhānaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā payāgapatiṭṭhāne gaṅgaṃ nadiṃ uttaritvā yena bārāṇasī tadavasari.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.18.eng: After remaining in Verañjā for as long as he liked, the Buddha traveled to Payāgapatiṭṭhāna via Soreyya, Saṅkassa, and Kaṇṇakujja. There he crossed the river Ganges and continued on to Benares.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.18.comm: Regarding these names, Ven. Shravasti Dhammika of Australia tells me (private communication) the following about the geographical situation of these places: “Verañjā is probably the huge mound at Atranji Khera, about 13 km. north of Etah in Uttar Pradesh; Soreyya is possibly Soron, directly south of Verañjā; Saṅkassa is the modern Sankisa; Kaṇṇakujja is the modern Kannauj; and Payāgapatiṭṭhāna is, as Horner correctly says, Allahabad, recently renamed Prayag, its original name. Except for the uncertain Soreyya, all these places are on a roughly west/east alignment, undoubtedly following the ancient Madhura to Payāga road.” In a subsequent email he clarified that Soron is actually north of Atranjki Khera or Verañjā. Following the modern road network, the total distance from Atranji Khera to Vaishali (Vesālī), according to Google maps, is in excess of 900 kilometers.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.19.pli: Atha kho bhagavā bārāṇasiyaṃ yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena vesālī tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.19.eng: After remaining at Benares for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Vesālī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.20.pli: Anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena vesālī tadavasari.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.21.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.21.eng: he stayed in the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:4.22.eng: The section for recitation on Verañjā is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.0.1.eng: The first training rule on expulsion

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.0.2.eng: First sub-story: the section for recitation on Sudinna

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena vesāliyā avidūre kalandagāmo nāma atthi. Tattha sudinno nāma kalandaputto seṭṭhiputto hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.1.eng: At that time Sudinna, the son of a wealthy merchant, lived in a village called Kalanda not far from Vesālī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.2.pli: Atha kho sudinno kalandaputto sambahulehi sahāyakehi saddhiṃ vesāliṃ agamāsi kenacideva karaṇīyena.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.2.eng: On one occasion Sudinna went to Vesālī on some business together with a number of friends.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā mahatiyā parisāya parivuto dhammaṃ desento nisinno hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.3.eng: Just then the Buddha was seated giving a teaching, surrounded by a large gathering of people.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.4.pli: Addasa kho sudinno kalandaputto bhagavantaṃ mahatiyā parisāya parivutaṃ dhammaṃ desentaṃ nisinnaṃ. Disvānassa etadahosi—“yannūnāhampi dhammaṃ suṇeyyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.4.eng: When Sudinna saw this, he thought, “Why don’t I listen to the Teaching?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.5.pli: Atha kho sudinno kalandaputto yena sā parisā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.5.eng: He then approached that gathering and sat down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.6.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnassa kho sudinnassa kalandaputtassa etadahosi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.6.eng: As he was sitting there, he thought,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.7.pli: “yathā yathā kho ahaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi, nayidaṃ sukaraṃ agāraṃ ajjhāvasatā ekantaparipuṇṇaṃ ekantaparisuddhaṃ saṅkhalikhitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carituṃ;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.7.eng: “The way I understand the Buddha’s Teaching, it’s not easy for one who lives at home to lead the spiritual life perfectly complete and pure as a polished conch shell.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.8.pli: yannūnāhaṃ kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajeyyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.8.eng: Why don’t I cut off my hair and beard, put on the ocher robes, and go forth into homelessness?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.9.pli: Atha kho sā parisā bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā samādapitā samuttejitā sampahaṃsitā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.9.eng: When those people had been instructed, inspired, and gladdened by the Buddha, they got up from their seats, bowed down, circumambulated him with their right sides toward him, and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.10.pli: Atha kho sudinno kalandaputto aciravuṭṭhitāya parisāya yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho sudinno kalandaputto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.10.eng: Sudinna then approached the Buddha, bowed, sat down, and told him what he had thought, adding,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.11.pli: “yathā yathāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi, nayidaṃ sukaraṃ agāraṃ ajjhāvasatā ekantaparipuṇṇaṃ ekantaparisuddhaṃ saṅkhalikhitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carituṃ;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.12.pli: icchāmahaṃ, bhante, kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajituṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.13.eng: “Sir, please give me the going forth.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.14.pli: “Anuññātosi pana tvaṃ, sudinna, mātāpitūhi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjāyā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.14.eng: “But, Sudinna, do you have your parents’ permission?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.15.pli: “Na kho ahaṃ, bhante, anuññāto mātāpitūhi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjāyā”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.16.pli: “Na kho, sudinna, tathāgatā ananuññātaṃ mātāpitūhi puttaṃ pabbājentī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.16.eng: “Buddhas don’t give the going forth to anyone who hasn’t gotten their parents’ permission.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.17.pli: “Sohaṃ, bhante, tathā karissāmi yathā maṃ mātāpitaro anujānissanti agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.1.17.eng: “I’ll do whatever is necessary, sir, to get my parents’ permission.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.1.pli: Atha kho sudinno kalandaputto vesāliyaṃ taṃ karaṇīyaṃ tīretvā yena kalandagāmo yena mātāpitaro tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā mātāpitaro etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.1.eng: After finishing his business in Vesālī, Sudinna returned to Kalanda. He then went to his parents and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.2.pli: “ammatātā, yathā yathāhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi, nayidaṃ sukaraṃ agāraṃ ajjhāvasatā ekantaparipuṇṇaṃ ekantaparisuddhaṃ saṅkhalikhitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carituṃ;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.2.eng: “Mom and dad, the way I understand the Buddha’s Teaching, it’s not easy for one who lives at home to lead the spiritual life perfectly complete and pure.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.3.pli: icchāmahaṃ kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.3.eng: I want to cut off my hair and beard, put on the ocher robes, and go forth into homelessness.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.4.eng: Please give me permission to go forth.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.5.pli: Evaṃ vutte, sudinnassa kalandaputtassa mātāpitaro sudinnaṃ kalandaputtaṃ etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.6.pli: “tvaṃ khosi, tāta sudinna, amhākaṃ ekaputtako piyo manāpo sukhedhito sukhaparihato. Na tvaṃ, tāta sudinna, kiñci dukkhassa jānāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.6.eng: “But, Sudinna, you’re our only child, and we love you dearly. You live in comfort and we care for you. You don’t have any suffering.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.7.pli: Maraṇenapi mayaṃ te akāmakā vinā bhavissāma
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.7.eng: Even if you died we wouldn’t want to lose you.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.8.pli: kiṃ pana mayaṃ taṃ jīvantaṃ anujānissāma agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.8.eng: So how can we allow you to go forth into homelessness while you’re still living?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.9.pli: Dutiyampi kho sudinno kalandaputto mātāpitaro etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.9.eng: Sudinna asked his parents a second

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.10.pli: “ammatātā, yathā yathāhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi, nayidaṃ sukaraṃ agāraṃ ajjhāvasatā ekantaparipuṇṇaṃ ekantaparisuddhaṃ saṅkhalikhitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carituṃ;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.11.pli: icchāmahaṃ kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajituṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.13.pli: Dutiyampi kho sudinnassa kalandaputtassa mātāpitaro sudinnaṃ kalandaputtaṃ etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.14.pli: “tvaṃ khosi, tāta sudinna, amhākaṃ ekaputtako piyo manāpo sukhedhito sukhaparihato.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.15.pli: Na tvaṃ, tāta sudinna, kiñci dukkhassa jānāsi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.16.pli: Maraṇenapi mayaṃ te akāmakā vinā bhavissāma,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.17.pli: kiṃ pana mayaṃ taṃ jīvantaṃ anujānissāma agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjāyā”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.18.pli: Tatiyampi kho sudinno kalandaputto mātāpitaro etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.19.pli: “ammatātā, yathā yathāhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi, nayidaṃ sukaraṃ agāraṃ ajjhāvasatā ekantaparipuṇṇaṃ ekantaparisuddhaṃ saṅkhalikhitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carituṃ;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.20.pli: icchāmahaṃ kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajituṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.22.pli: Tatiyampi kho sudinnassa kalandaputtassa mātāpitaro sudinnaṃ kalandaputtaṃ etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.23.pli: “tvaṃ khosi, tāta sudinna, amhākaṃ ekaputtako piyo manāpo sukhedhito sukhaparihato.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.24.pli: Na tvaṃ, tāta sudinna, kiñci dukkhassa jānāsi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.25.pli: Maraṇenapi mayaṃ te akāmakā vinā bhavissāma,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.26.pli: kiṃ pana mayaṃ taṃ jīvantaṃ anujānissāma agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjāyā”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.27.pli: Atha kho sudinno kalandaputto—“na maṃ mātāpitaro anujānanti agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjāyā”ti,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.28.eng: He then lay down on the bare ground and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.29.eng: “I’ll either die right here or go forth!”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.30.pli: Atha kho sudinno kalandaputto ekampi bhattaṃ na bhuñji, dvepi bhattāni na bhuñji, tīṇipi bhattāni na bhuñji, cattāripi bhattāni na bhuñji, pañcapi bhattāni na bhuñji, chapi bhattāni na bhuñji, sattapi bhattāni na bhuñji.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.30.eng: And he did not eat at the next seven meals.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.31.pli: Atha kho sudinnassa kalandaputtassa mātāpitaro sudinnaṃ kalandaputtaṃ etadavocuṃ—“tvaṃ khosi, tāta sudinna, amhākaṃ ekaputtako piyo manāpo sukhedhito sukhaparihato.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.31.eng: His parents repeated what they had said, adding,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.32.pli: Na tvaṃ, tāta sudinna, kiñci dukkhassa jānāsi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.33.pli: Maraṇenapi mayaṃ te akāmakā vinā bhavissāma,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.34.pli: kiṃ pana mayaṃ taṃ jīvantaṃ anujānissāma agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjāya?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.35.pli: Uṭṭhehi, tāta sudinna, bhuñja ca piva ca paricārehi ca,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.35.eng: “Get up, Sudinna, eat, drink, and enjoy yourself!

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.36.pli: bhuñjanto pivanto paricārento kāme paribhuñjanto puññāni karonto abhiramassu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.36.eng: Enjoy the pleasures of the world and do acts of merit.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.37.pli: Na taṃ mayaṃ anujānāma agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.37.eng: We won’t allow you to go forth.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.38.pli: Evaṃ vutte, sudinno kalandaputto tuṇhī ahosi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.39.eng: His parents said the same thing a second

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.40.pli: tatiyampi kho sudinnassa kalandaputtassa mātāpitaro sudinnaṃ kalandaputtaṃ etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.41.pli: “tvaṃ khosi, tāta sudinna, amhākaṃ ekaputtako piyo manāpo sukhedhito sukhaparihato.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.42.pli: Na tvaṃ, tāta sudinna, kiñci dukkhassa jānāsi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.43.pli: Maraṇenapi mayaṃ te akāmakā vinā bhavissāma,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.44.pli: kiṃ pana mayaṃ taṃ jīvantaṃ anujānissāma agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjāya.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.45.pli: Uṭṭhehi, tāta sudinna, bhuñja ca piva ca paricārehi ca,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.46.pli: bhuñjanto pivanto paricārento kāme paribhuñjanto puññāni karonto abhiramassu.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.47.pli: Na taṃ mayaṃ anujānāma agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjāyā”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.2.48.pli: Tatiyampi kho sudinno kalandaputto tuṇhī ahosi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.3.1.pli: Atha kho sudinnassa kalandaputtassa sahāyakā yena sudinno kalandaputto tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā sudinnaṃ kalandaputtaṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.3.1.eng: Then Sudinna’s friends went to him and repeated three times what his parents had said.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.3.2.pli: “tvaṃ khosi, samma sudinna, mātāpitūnaṃ ekaputtako piyo manāpo sukhedhito sukhaparihato.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.3.3.pli: Na tvaṃ, samma sudinna, kiñci dukkhassa jānāsi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.3.4.pli: Maraṇenapi te mātāpitaro akāmakā vinā bhavissanti,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.3.5.pli: kiṃ pana taṃ jīvantaṃ anujānissanti agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajāya.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.3.6.pli: Uṭṭhehi, samma sudinna, bhuñja ca piva ca paricārehi ca,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.3.7.pli: bhuñjanto pivanto paricārento kāme paribhuñjanto puññāni karonto abhiramassu,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.3.8.pli: na taṃ mātāpitaro anujānissanti agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjāyā”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.3.9.pli: Evaṃ vutte, sudinno kalandaputto tuṇhī ahosi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.3.11.pli: tatiyampi kho sudinnassa kalandaputtassa sahāyakā sudinnaṃ kalandaputtaṃ etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.3.13.pli: tatiyampi kho sudinno kalandaputto tuṇhī ahosi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.3.13.eng: When Sudinna still did not respond,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.1.pli: Atha kho sudinnassa kalandaputtassa sahāyakā yena sudinnassa kalandaputtassa mātāpitaro tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā sudinnassa kalandaputtassa mātāpitaro etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.1.eng: Sudinna’s friends went to his parents and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.3.eng: “Sudinna says he’ll either die right there on the bare ground or go forth.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.4.pli: Sace tumhe sudinnaṃ nānujānissatha agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjāya, tattheva maraṇaṃ āgamissati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.4.eng: If you don’t allow him to go forth, he’ll die there.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.5.pli: Sace pana tumhe sudinnaṃ anujānissatha agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjāya, pabbajitampi naṃ dakkhissatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.5.eng: But if you allow him to go forth, you’ll see him again afterwards.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.6.pli: Sace sudinno nābhiramissati agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjāya, kā tassa aññā gati bhavissati, idheva paccāgamissati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.6.eng: And if he doesn’t enjoy the going forth, what alternative will he have but to come back here?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.7.eng: So please allow him to go forth.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.9.pli: Atha kho sudinnassa kalandaputtassa sahāyakā yena sudinno kalandaputto tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā sudinnaṃ kalandaputtaṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.9.eng: And Sudinna’s friends said to him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.10.pli: “uṭṭhehi, samma sudinna, anuññātosi mātāpitūhi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.10.eng: “Get up, Sudinna, your parents have given you permission to go forth.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.11.pli: Atha kho sudinno kalandaputto—“anuññātomhi kira mātāpitūhi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjāyā”ti, haṭṭho udaggo pāṇinā gattāni paripuñchanto vuṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.11.eng: When Sudinna heard this, he was excited and joyful, stroking his limbs with his hands as he got up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.12.pli: Atha kho sudinno kalandaputto katipāhaṃ balaṃ gāhetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho sudinno kalandaputto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.12.eng: After spending a few days to regain his strength, he went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down, and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.13.pli: “anuññāto ahaṃ, bhante, mātāpitūhi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.13.eng: “Sir, I’ve gotten my parents’ permission to go forth.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.14.eng: Please give me the going forth.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.15.pli: Alattha kho sudinno kalandaputto bhagavato santike pabbajjaṃ, alattha upasampadaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.15.eng: He then received the going forth and the full ordination in the presence of the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.16.pli: Acirūpasampanno ca panāyasmā sudinno evarūpe dhutaguṇe samādāya vattati, āraññiko hoti piṇḍapātiko paṃsukūliko sapadānacāriko,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.16.eng: Not long afterwards he practiced these kinds of ascetic practices: he stayed in the wilderness, ate only almsfood, was a rag-robe wearer, and went on continuous almsround.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.4.17.eng: And he lived supported by a certain Vajjian village.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena vajjī dubbhikkhā hoti dvīhitikā setaṭṭhikā salākāvuttā, na sukarā uñchena paggahena yāpetuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.5.1.eng: Soon afterwards, the Vajjians were short of food and afflicted with hunger, with crops affected by whiteheads and turned to straw. It was not easy to get by on almsfood.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.5.2.pli: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa etadahosi—“etarahi kho vajjī dubbhikkhā dvīhitikā setaṭṭhikā salākāvuttā, na sukarā uñchena paggahena yāpetuṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.5.3.pli: Bahū kho pana me vesāliyaṃ ñātī aḍḍhā mahaddhanā mahābhogā pahūtajātarūparajatā pahūtavittūpakaraṇā pahūtadhanadhaññā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.5.3.eng: “I have many wealthy relatives in Vesālī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.5.4.eng: Why don’t I get them to support me?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.5.5.pli: Ñātī maṃ nissāya dānāni dassanti puññāni karissanti, bhikkhū ca lābhaṃ lacchanti, ahañca piṇḍakena na kilamissāmī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.5.5.eng: My relatives will be able to make offerings and merit, the monks will get material support, and I’ll have no trouble getting almsfood.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.5.6.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sudinno senāsanaṃ saṃsāmetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena vesālī tena pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.5.6.eng: He then put his dwelling in order, took his bowl and robe, and set out for Vesālī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.5.7.pli: Anupubbena yena vesālī tadavasari. Tatra sudaṃ āyasmā sudinno vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.5.7.eng: When he eventually arrived, he stayed in the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.5.8.pli: Assosuṃ kho āyasmato sudinnassa ñātakā—“sudinno kira kalandaputto vesāliṃ anuppatto”ti. Te āyasmato sudinnassa saṭṭhimatte thālipāke bhattābhihāraṃ abhihariṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.5.8.eng: His relatives heard that he had arrived in Vesālī, and they presented him with an offering of sixty servings of food.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.5.9.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sudinno te saṭṭhimatte thālipāke bhikkhūnaṃ vissajjetvā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya kalandagāmaṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.5.9.eng: Sudinna gave the sixty servings to the monks. He then took his bowl and robe and went to the village of Kalanda for alms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.5.10.pli: Kalandagāme sapadānaṃ piṇḍāya caramāno yena sakapitu nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.5.10.eng: As he was going on continuous almsround, he came to his own father’s house.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato sudinnassa ñātidāsī ābhidosikaṃ kummāsaṃ chaḍḍetukāmā hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.1.eng: Just then a female slave of Sudinna’s relatives was about to throw away the previous evening’s porridge.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.2.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sudinno taṃ ñātidāsiṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.3.pli: “sace taṃ, bhagini, chaḍḍanīyadhammaṃ, idha me patte ākirā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.3.eng: “If that’s to be thrown away, sister, put it here in my almsbowl.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.4.pli: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa ñātidāsī taṃ ābhidosikaṃ kummāsaṃ āyasmato sudinnassa patte ākirantī hatthānañca pādānañca sarassa ca nimittaṃ aggahesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.4.eng: As she was putting the porridge into his bowl, she recognized his hands, feet, and voice.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.5.pli: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa ñātidāsī yenāyasmato sudinnassa mātā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmato sudinnassa mātaraṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.5.eng: She then went to his mother and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.8.pli: “Sace, je, tvaṃ saccaṃ bhaṇasi, adāsiṃ taṃ karomī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.8.eng: “Gosh, if you’re telling the truth, you’re a free woman!”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.9.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā sudinno taṃ ābhidosikaṃ kummāsaṃ aññataraṃ kuṭṭamūlaṃ nissāya paribhuñjati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.9.eng: As Sudinna was eating the previous evening’s porridge at the base of a certain wall,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.10.pli: Pitāpi kho āyasmato sudinnassa kammantā āgacchanto addasa āyasmantaṃ sudinnaṃ taṃ ābhidosikaṃ kummāsaṃ aññataraṃ kuṭṭamūlaṃ nissāya paribhuñjantaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.10.eng: his father was coming home from work.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.11.pli: Disvāna yenāyasmā sudinno tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ sudinnaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.11.eng: When he saw him sitting there, he went up to him and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.12.pli: “atthi nāma, tāta sudinna, ābhidosikaṃ kummāsaṃ paribhuñjissasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.12.eng: “But, Sudinna, isn’t there … What! You’re eating old porridge!
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.12.comm: Sp 1.32: Idañhi vuttaṁ hoti – “atthi nu kho, tāta sudinna, amhākaṁ dhanaṁ, na mayaṁ niddhanāti”; “For this is said: ‘Isn’t there, dear Sudinna, our wealth? We are not poor.’” The point, perhaps, is that the father meant to say much more, but was interrupted at the shock of seeing his son eating old porridge.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.13.pli: Nanu nāma, tāta sudinna, sakaṃ gehaṃ gantabban”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.13.eng: Why don’t you come to your own house?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.15.eng: That’s where we received this porridge.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.16.pli: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa pitā āyasmato sudinnassa bāhāyaṃ gahetvā āyasmantaṃ sudinnaṃ etadavoca— “ehi, tāta sudinna, gharaṃ gamissāmā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.16.eng: Sudinna’s father took him by the arm and said, “Come, let’s go home.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.17.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sudinno yena sakapitu nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.17.eng: Sudinna went to his father’s house and sat down on the prepared seat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.18.pli: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa pitā āyasmantaṃ sudinnaṃ etadavoca— “bhuñja, tāta sudinnā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.18.eng: His father said to him, “Please eat, Sudinna.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.19.eng: “There’s no need. I’m done for today.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.20.eng: “Then come back for the meal tomorrow.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.21.pli: Adhivāsesi kho āyasmā sudinno tuṇhībhāvena. Atha kho āyasmā sudinno uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.21.eng: Sudinna consented by keeping silent, and he got up from his seat and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.22.pli: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa mātā tassā rattiyā accayena haritena gomayena pathaviṃ opuñjāpetvā dve puñje kārāpesi—ekaṃ hiraññassa, ekaṃ suvaṇṇassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.22.eng: The next morning Sudinna’s mother had the floor smeared with fresh cow-dung. She then piled up two heaps, one with money, the other with gold.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.22.comm: For the rendering of hirañña as “money”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.23.pli: Tāva mahantā puñjā ahesuṃ, orato ṭhito puriso pārato ṭhitaṃ purisaṃ na passati; pārato ṭhito puriso orato ṭhitaṃ purisaṃ na passati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.23.eng: The heaps were so large that a man standing on one side could not see a man standing on the other.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.24.pli: Te puñje kilañjehi paṭicchādāpetvā majjhe āsanaṃ paññāpetvā tirokaraṇīyaṃ parikkhipitvā āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikaṃ āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.24.eng: She hid the heaps behind screens, prepared a seat between them, and surrounded it all with a curtain. And she said to Sudinna’s ex-wife,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.25.pli: “tena hi, vadhu, yena alaṅkārena alaṅkatā puttassa me sudinnassa piyā ahosi manāpā tena alaṅkārena alaṅkarā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.25.eng: “Now please adorn yourself in the way our son Sudinna found you especially attractive.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.6.26.pli: “Evaṃ, ayye”ti, kho āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikā āyasmato sudinnassa mātuyā paccassosi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sudinno pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena sakapitu nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.1.eng: Then, after robing up, Venerable Sudinna took his bowl and robe and went to his father’s house where he sat down on the prepared seat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.2.pli: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa pitā yenāyasmā sudinno tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā te puñje vivarāpetvā āyasmantaṃ sudinnaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.2.eng: His father went up to him, uncovered the heaps, and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.3.pli: “idaṃ te, tāta sudinna, mātu mattikaṃ itthikāya itthidhanaṃ, aññaṃ pettikaṃ aññaṃ pitāmahaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.3.eng: “This dowry, dear Sudinna, is the fortune from your mother. It’s yours. Another is the fortune from your father and another the fortune from your ancestors.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.4.pli: Labbhā, tāta sudinna, hīnāyāvattitvā bhogā ca bhuñjituṃ puññāni ca kātuṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.5.pli: Ehi tvaṃ, tāta sudinna, hīnāyāvattitvā bhoge ca bhuñjassu puññāni ca karohī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.5.eng: Please return to the lower life, enjoy wealth, and make merit.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.6.pli: “Tāta, na ussahāmi na visahāmi, abhirato ahaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carāmī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.6.eng: “I can’t, father. I’m enjoying the spiritual life.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.7.eng: Sudinna’s father repeated his request and Sudinna replied as before.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.8.pli: tatiyampi kho āyasmato sudinnassa pitā āyasmantaṃ sudinnaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.8.eng: When Sudinna’s father repeated his request a third time, Sudinna said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.9.pli: “idaṃ te, tāta sudinna, mātu mattikaṃ, itthikāya itthidhanaṃ, aññaṃ pettikaṃ, aññaṃ pitāmahaṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.10.pli: Labbhā, tāta sudinna, hīnāyāvattitvā bhogā ca bhuñjituṃ puññāni ca kātuṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.11.pli: Ehi tvaṃ, tāta sudinna, hīnāyāvattitvā bhoge ca bhuñjassu puññāni ca karohī”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.12.pli: “Vadeyyāma kho taṃ, gahapati, sace tvaṃ nātikaḍḍheyyāsī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.12.eng: “If you wouldn’t get offended, I could tell you what to do.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.14.pli: “Tena hi tvaṃ, gahapati, mahante mahante sāṇipasibbake kārāpetvā hiraññasuvaṇṇassa pūrāpetvā sakaṭehi nibbāhāpetvā majjhe gaṅgāya sote opātehi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.14.eng: “Well then, make some large hempen sacks, put all the money and gold inside, take it all away in carts, and dump it in the middle of the Ganges.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.16.pli: Yañhi te, gahapati, bhavissati tatonidānaṃ bhayaṃ vā chambhitattaṃ vā lomahaṃso vā ārakkho vā so te na bhavissatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.16.eng: Because that way you will avoid the danger, fear, and terror that it will otherwise cause you, as well as the trouble with protecting it.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.17.pli: Evaṃ vutte, āyasmato sudinnassa pitā anattamano ahosi— “kathañhi nāma putto sudinno evaṃ vakkhatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.17.eng: His father became upset, thinking, “How can our son Sudinna say such things?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.18.pli: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa pitā āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikaṃ āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.18.eng: He then said to Sudinna’s ex-wife,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.19.pli: “tena hi, vadhu, tvaṃ piyā ca manāpā ca. Appeva nāma putto sudinno tuyhampi vacanaṃ kareyyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.19.eng: “Well then, since you were so dear to him, perhaps our son Sudinna will listen to you?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.20.pli: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikā āyasmato sudinnassa pādesu gahetvā āyasmantaṃ sudinnaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.20.eng: Sudinna’s ex-wife took hold of his feet and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.21.pli: “kīdisā nāma tā, ayyaputta, accharāyo yāsaṃ tvaṃ hetu brahmacariyaṃ carasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.21.eng: “What are these nymphs like, sir, for which you practice the spiritual life?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.22.pli: “Na kho ahaṃ, bhagini, accharānaṃ hetu brahmacariyaṃ carāmī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.22.eng: “Sister, I don’t practice the spiritual life for the sake of nymphs.”
