pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.23.pli: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikā— “ajjatagge maṃ ayyaputto sudinno bhaginivādena samudācaratī”ti, tattheva mucchitā papatā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.7.23.eng: His ex-wife thought, “Sudinna is now calling me ‘sister’,” and she fainted right there.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.8.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sudinno pitaraṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.8.2.eng: “If there’s food to be given, householder, give it,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.8.5.pli: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa mātā ca pitā ca āyasmantaṃ sudinnaṃ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesuṃ sampavāresuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.8.5.eng: And Sudinna’s mother and father personally served and satisfied him with various kinds of fine foods.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.8.6.pli: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa mātā āyasmantaṃ sudinnaṃ bhuttāviṃ onītapattapāṇiṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.8.6.eng: When Sudinna had finished his meal, his mother said to him:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.8.7.pli: “idaṃ, tāta sudinna, kulaṃ aḍḍhaṃ mahaddhanaṃ mahābhogaṃ pahūtajātarūparajataṃ pahūtavittūpakaraṇaṃ pahūtadhanadhaññaṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.8.8.pli: Labbhā, tāta sudinna, hīnāyāvattitvā bhogā ca bhuñjituṃ puññāni ca kātuṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.8.9.pli: Ehi tvaṃ, tāta sudinna, hīnāyāvattitvā bhoge ca bhuñjassu puññāni ca karohī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.8.9.eng: Please return to the lower life, enjoy wealth, and make merit.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.8.10.pli: “Amma, na ussahāmi na visahāmi, abhirato ahaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carāmī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.8.10.eng: “Mother, I can’t. I’m enjoying the spiritual life.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.8.11.eng: His mother repeated her request a second time, but got the same reply.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.8.12.pli: tatiyampi kho āyasmato sudinnassa mātā āyasmantaṃ sudinnaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.8.13.pli: “idaṃ, tāta sudinna, kulaṃ aḍḍhaṃ mahaddhanaṃ mahābhogaṃ pahūtajātarūparajataṃ pahūtavittūpakaraṇaṃ pahūtadhanadhaññaṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.8.14.pli: Tena hi, tāta sudinna, bījakampi dehi—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.8.15.pli: mā no aputtakaṃ sāpateyyaṃ licchavayo atiharāpesun”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.8.15.eng: so that the Licchavīs don’t take over our heirless property.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.8.19.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sudinno uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.8.19.eng: And he got up from his seat and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa mātā āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikaṃ āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.1.eng: Sudinna’s mother then said to his ex-wife,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.2.pli: “tena hi, vadhu, yadā utunī ahosi, pupphaṃ te uppannaṃ hoti, atha me āroceyyāsī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.2.eng: “Well then, as soon as you reach your fertile period, please tell me.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.3.pli: “Evaṃ, ayye”ti kho āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikā āyasmato sudinnassa mātuyā paccassosi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.4.pli: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikā nacirasseva utunī ahosi, pupphaṃsā uppajji.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.4.eng: Not long afterwards Sudinna’s ex-wife reached her fertile period,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.5.pli: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikā āyasmato sudinnassa mātaraṃ etadavoca—“utunīmhi, ayye, pupphaṃ me uppannan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.5.eng: and she reported it to Sudinna’s mother.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.6.pli: “Tena hi, vadhu, yena alaṅkārena alaṅkatā puttassa sudinnassa piyā ahosi manāpā tena alaṅkārena alaṅkarā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.6.eng: “Now, please adorn yourself in the way that our son Sudinna found you especially attractive.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.7.pli: “Evaṃ, ayye”ti kho āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikā āyasmato sudinnassa mātuyā paccassosi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.8.pli: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa mātā āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikaṃ ādāya yena mahāvanaṃ yenāyasmā sudinno tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ sudinnaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.8.eng: Then Sudinna’s mother, together with his ex-wife, went to Sudinna in the Great Wood, and she said to him:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.9.pli: “idaṃ, tāta sudinna, kulaṃ aḍḍhaṃ mahaddhanaṃ mahābhogaṃ pahūtajātarūparajataṃ pahūtavittūpakaraṇaṃ pahūtadhanadhaññaṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.10.pli: Labbhā, tāta sudinna, hīnāyāvattitvā bhogā ca bhuñjituṃ puññāni ca kātuṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.11.pli: Ehi tvaṃ, tāta sudinna, hīnāyāvattitvā bhoge ca bhuñjassu puññāni ca karohī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.11.eng: Please return to the lower life, enjoy wealth, and make merit.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.14.eng: His mother repeated her request a second time, but got the same reply.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.15.pli: tatiyampi kho āyasmato sudinnassa mātā āyasmantaṃ sudinnaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.16.pli: “idaṃ, tāta sudinna, kulaṃ aḍḍhaṃ mahaddhanaṃ mahābhogaṃ pahūtajātarūparajataṃ pahūtavittūpakaraṇaṃ pahūtadhanadhaññaṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.17.pli: Tena hi, tāta sudinna, bījakampi dehi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.17.eng: “Well then, please give us an offspring.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.18.pli: mā no aputtakaṃ sāpateyyaṃ licchavayo atiharāpesun”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.18.eng: We don’t want the Licchavīs to take over our heirless property.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.20.pli: purāṇadutiyikāya bāhāyaṃ gahetvā mahāvanaṃ ajjhogāhetvā apaññatte sikkhāpade anādīnavadasso purāṇadutiyikāya tikkhattuṃ methunaṃ dhammaṃ abhiviññāpesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.20.eng: He then took his ex-wife by the arm, disappeared into the Great Wood and—there being no training rule and he seeing no danger—had sexual intercourse with her three times.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.22.eng: And the earth gods cried out:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.23.eng: “Sirs, the Sangha of monks has been free from cancer and danger.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.24.pli: sudinnena kalandaputtena abbudaṃ uppāditaṃ, ādīnavo uppādito”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.24.eng: But Sudinna of Kalanda has produced a cancer and endangered it.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.25.pli: Bhummānaṃ devānaṃ saddaṃ sutvā cātumahārājikā devā saddamanussāvesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.25.eng: Hearing the earth gods, the gods of the four great kings cried out …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.29.eng: the gods who delight in creation …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.30.eng: the gods who control the creation of others …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.31.eng: the gods of the realm of the supreme beings cried out:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.32.eng: “Sirs, the Sangha of monks has been free from cancer and danger.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.33.pli: sudinnena kalandaputtena abbudaṃ uppāditaṃ, ādīnavo uppādito”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.33.eng: But Sudinna of Kalanda has produced a cancer and endangered it.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.34.pli: Itiha tena khaṇena tena muhuttena yāva brahmalokā saddo abbhuggacchi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.34.eng: Thus in that moment, in that instance, the news spread as far as the world of the supreme beings.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.35.pli: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikā tassa gabbhassa paripākamanvāya puttaṃ vijāyi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.35.eng: In the meantime, the pregnancy of Sudinna’s ex-wife developed, and she eventually gave birth to a son.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.36.pli: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa sahāyakā tassa dārakassa bījakoti nāmaṃ akaṃsu.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.37.pli: Āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikāya bījakamātāti nāmaṃ akaṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.37.eng: while calling Sudinna’s ex-wife Offspring’s mother,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.39.pli: Te aparena samayena ubho agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajitvā arahattaṃ sacchākaṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.9.39.eng: After some time, they both went forth into homelessness and realized perfection.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa ahudeva kukkuccaṃ, ahu vippaṭisāro—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.1.eng: But Sudinna was anxious and remorseful, thinking,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.2.pli: “alābhā vata me, na vata me lābhā; dulladdhaṃ vata me, na vata me suladdhaṃ;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.3.pli: yohaṃ evaṃ svākkhāte dhammavinaye pabbajitvā nāsakkhiṃ yāvajīvaṃ paripuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ caritun”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.3.eng: that after going forth on such a well-proclaimed spiritual path, I wasn’t able to practice the perfectly complete and pure spiritual life to the end.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.3.comm: “Spiritual path” renders dhammavinaya. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.4.pli: So teneva kukkuccena tena vippaṭisārena kiso ahosi lūkho dubbaṇṇo uppaṇḍuppaṇḍukajāto dhamanisanthatagatto antomano līnamano dukkhī dummano vippaṭisārī pajjhāyi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.4.eng: And because of his anxiety and remorse, he became thin, haggard, and pale, with veins protruding all over his body. He became sad, sluggish, miserable, and depressed, weighed down by remorse.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.5.pli: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa sahāyakā bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ sudinnaṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.5.eng: The monks who were Sudinna’s friends said to him:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.6.pli: “pubbe kho tvaṃ, āvuso sudinna, vaṇṇavā ahosi pīṇindriyo pasannamukhavaṇṇo vippasannachavivaṇṇo;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.6.eng: “In the past, Sudinna, you had a good color, a bright face, clear skin, and sharp senses.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.7.pli: so dāni tvaṃ etarahi kiso lūkho dubbaṇṇo uppaṇḍuppaṇḍukajāto dhamanisanthatagatto antomano līnamano dukkhī dummano vippaṭisārī pajjhāyasi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.8.pli: Kacci no tvaṃ, āvuso sudinna, anabhirato brahmacariyaṃ carasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.8.eng: Could it be that you are dissatisfied with the spiritual life?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.9.pli: “Na kho ahaṃ, āvuso, anabhirato brahmacariyaṃ carāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.9.eng: “I am not dissatisfied with the spiritual life,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.11.eng: I’ve had sexual intercourse with my ex-wife.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.12.pli: tassa mayhaṃ, āvuso, ahudeva kukkuccaṃ ahu vippaṭisāro—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.13.pli: ‘alābhā vata me, na vata me lābhā; dulladdhaṃ vata me, na vata me suladdhaṃ; yohaṃ evaṃ svākkhāte dhammavinaye pabbajitvā nāsakkhiṃ yāvajīvaṃ paripuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ caritun’”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.13.eng: because I wasn’t able to practice the perfectly complete and pure spiritual life to the end.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.14.pli: “Alañhi te, āvuso sudinna, kukkuccāya alaṃ vippaṭisārāya yaṃ tvaṃ evaṃ svākkhāte dhammavinaye pabbajitvā na sakkhissasi yāvajīvaṃ paripuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.14.eng: “No wonder you’re anxious, Sudinna, no wonder you have remorse.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.15.pli: Nanu, āvuso, bhagavatā anekapariyāyena virāgāya dhammo desito, no sarāgāya;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.15.eng: Hasn’t the Buddha given many teachings for the sake of dispassion, not for the sake of lust;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.16.eng: for the sake of freedom from bondage, not for the sake of bondage;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.17.eng: for the sake of non-grasping, not for the sake of grasping?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.18.pli: Tattha nāma tvaṃ, āvuso, bhagavatā virāgāya dhamme desite sarāgāya cetessasi, visaṃyogāya dhamme desite saṃyogāya cetessasi, anupādānāya dhamme desite saupādānāya cetessasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.18.eng: When the Buddha has taught in this way, how could you choose lust, bondage, and grasping?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.19.pli: Nanu, āvuso, bhagavatā anekapariyāyena rāgavirāgāya dhammo desito,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.19.eng: Hasn’t the Buddha given many teachings for the fading away of lust,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.20.pli: madanimmadanāya pipāsavinayāya ālayasamugghātāya vaṭṭupacchedāya taṇhākkhayāya virāgāya nirodhāya nibbānāya dhammo desito.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.20.eng: for the clearing away of intoxication, for the removal of thirst, for the uprooting of attachment, for the cutting off of the round of rebirth, for the stopping of craving, for fading away, for ending, for extinguishment?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.21.pli: Nanu, āvuso, bhagavatā anekapariyāyena kāmānaṃ pahānaṃ akkhātaṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.21.eng: Hasn’t the Buddha in many ways taught the abandoning of worldly pleasures,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.22.eng: the full understanding of the perception of worldly pleasures,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.23.eng: the removal of thirst for worldly pleasures,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.24.eng: the elimination of thoughts of worldly pleasures,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.25.eng: the stilling of the fever of worldly pleasures?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.26.pli: Netaṃ, āvuso, appasannānaṃ vā pasādāya, pasannānaṃ vā bhiyyobhāvāya.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.27.pli: Atha khvetaṃ, āvuso, appasannānañceva appasādāya pasannānañca ekaccānaṃ aññathattāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.27.eng: and cause some to lose it.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.1.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ sudinnaṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.1.eng: After rebuking Sudinna in many ways, they told the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.2.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā āyasmantaṃ sudinnaṃ paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.2.eng: The Buddha then had the Sangha of monks gathered and questioned Sudinna:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.3.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, sudinna, purāṇadutiyikāya methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.3.eng: “Is it true, Sudinna, that you had sexual intercourse with your ex-wife?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.6.pli: “ananucchavikaṃ, moghapurisa, ananulomikaṃ appaṭirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.6.eng: “Foolish man, it’s not suitable, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.7.pli: Kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, evaṃ svākkhāte dhammavinaye pabbajitvā na sakkhissasi yāvajīvaṃ paripuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.7.eng: How could you go forth on such a well-proclaimed spiritual path and not be able to practice the perfectly complete and pure spiritual life to the end?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.8.pli: Nanu mayā, moghapurisa, anekapariyāyena virāgāya dhammo desito, no sarāgāya;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.8.eng: Haven’t I given many teachings for the sake of dispassion, not for the sake of lust;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.9.eng: for the sake of freedom from bondage, not for the sake of bondage;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.10.eng: for the sake of non-grasping, not for the sake of grasping?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.11.pli: Tattha nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, mayā virāgāya dhamme desite sarāgāya cetessasi, visaṃyogāya dhamme desite saṃyogāya cetessasi, anupādānāya dhamme desite saupādānāya cetessasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.11.eng: When I have taught in this way, how could you choose lust, bondage, and grasping?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.12.pli: Nanu mayā, moghapurisa, anekapariyāyena rāgavirāgāya dhammo desito.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.12.eng: Haven’t I given many teachings for the fading away of lust,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.13.pli: Madanimmadanāya pipāsavinayāya ālayasamugghātāya vaṭṭupacchedāya taṇhākkhayāya virāgāya nirodhāya nibbānāya dhammo desito.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.13.eng: for the clearing away of intoxication, for the removal of thirst, for the uprooting of attachment, for the cutting off of the round of rebirth, for the stopping of craving, for fading away, for ending, for extinguishment?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.14.pli: Nanu mayā, moghapurisa, anekapariyāyena kāmānaṃ pahānaṃ akkhātaṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.14.eng: Haven’t I in many ways taught the abandoning of worldly pleasures,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.15.eng: the full understanding of the perceptions of worldly pleasures,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.16.eng: the removal of thirst for worldly pleasures,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.17.eng: the elimination of thoughts of worldly pleasures,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.18.eng: the stilling of the fevers of worldly pleasures?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.19.pli: Varaṃ te, moghapurisa, āsivisassa ghoravisassa mukhe aṅgajātaṃ pakkhittaṃ, na tveva mātugāmassa aṅgajāte aṅgajātaṃ pakkhittaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.19.eng: It would be better, foolish man, for your penis to enter the mouth of a highly venomous snake than to enter a woman.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.20.pli: Varaṃ te, moghapurisa, kaṇhasappassa mukhe aṅgajātaṃ pakkhittaṃ, na tveva mātugāmassa aṅgajāte aṅgajātaṃ pakkhittaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.20.eng: It would be better for your penis to enter the mouth of a black snake than to enter a woman.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.21.pli: Varaṃ te, moghapurisa, aṅgārakāsuyā ādittāya sampajjalitāya sajotibhūtāya aṅgajātaṃ pakkhittaṃ, na tveva mātugāmassa aṅgajāte aṅgajātaṃ pakkhittaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.21.eng: It would be better for your penis to enter a blazing charcoal pit than to enter a woman.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.23.pli: Tatonidānañhi, moghapurisa, maraṇaṃ vā nigaccheyya maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhaṃ, na tveva tappaccayā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjeyya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.23.eng: For although it might cause death or death-like suffering, it would not cause you to be reborn in a bad destination.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.24.pli: Itonidānañca kho, moghapurisa, kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjeyya.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.25.pli: Tattha nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, yaṃ tvaṃ asaddhammaṃ gāmadhammaṃ vasaladhammaṃ duṭṭhullaṃ odakantikaṃ rahassaṃ dvayaṃdvayasamāpattiṃ samāpajjissasi,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.25.eng: Foolish man, you have practiced what is contrary to the true Teaching, the common practice, the low practice, the coarse practice, that which ends with a wash, that which is done in private, that which is done wherever there are couples.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.26.pli: bahūnaṃ kho tvaṃ, moghapurisa, akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ ādikattā pubbaṅgamo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.26.eng: You are the forerunner, the first performer of many unwholesome things.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.27.pli: Netaṃ, moghapurisa, appasannānaṃ vā pasādāya, pasannānaṃ vā bhiyyobhāvāya;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.28.pli: atha khvetaṃ, moghapurisa, appasannānañceva appasādāya, pasannānañca ekaccānaṃ aññathattāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.28.eng: and cause some to lose it.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.29.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ sudinnaṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā dubbharatāya dupposatāya mahicchatāya asantuṭṭhitāya saṅgaṇikāya kosajjassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitvā anekapariyāyena subharatāya suposatāya appicchassa santuṭṭhassa sallekhassa dhutassa pāsādikassa apacayassa vīriyārambhassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsitvā
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.29.eng: Then the Buddha spoke in many ways in dispraise of being difficult to support and maintain, in dispraise of great desires, discontent, socializing, and laziness; but he spoke in many ways in praise of being easy to support and maintain, of fewness of wishes, contentment, self-effacement, ascetic practices, serenity, reduction in things, and being energetic.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.30.pli: bhikkhūnaṃ tadanucchavikaṃ tadanulomikaṃ dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.30.eng: After giving a teaching on what is right and proper, he addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.31.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññapessāmi dasa atthavase paṭicca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.31.eng: “Well then, monks, I will lay down a training rule for the following ten reasons:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.32.pli: saṅghasuṭṭhutāya, saṅghaphāsutāya, dummaṅkūnaṃ puggalānaṃ niggahāya, pesalānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ phāsuvihārāya, diṭṭhadhammikānaṃ āsavānaṃ saṃvarāya, samparāyikānaṃ āsavānaṃ paṭighātāya, appasannānaṃ pasādāya, pasannānaṃ bhiyyobhāvāya, saddhammaṭṭhitiyā, vinayānuggahāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.32.eng: for the well-being of the Sangha, for the comfort of the Sangha, for the restraint of bad people, for the ease of good monks, for the restraint of the corruptions relating to the present life, for the restraint of the corruptions relating to future lives, to give rise to confidence in those without it, to increase the confidence of those who have it, for the longevity of the true Teaching, and for supporting the training.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.32.comm: “Training” renders vinaya. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.33.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.33.eng: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.34.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭiseveyya, pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.34.1.eng: ‘If a monk has sexual intercourse, he is expelled and excluded from the community.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.35.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.35.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.11.36.eng: The section for recitation on Sudinna is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.0.eng: Second sub-story: the account of the female monkey

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu vesāliyaṃ mahāvane makkaṭiṃ āmisena upalāpetvā tassā methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.1.eng: Sometime later, in the Great Wood near Vesālī, a certain monk befriended a female monkey by giving her food. He then had sexual intercourse with her.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.2.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaraṃ ādāya vesāliṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.2.eng: Soon afterwards, after robing up in the morning, he took his bowl and robe and entered Vesālī for alms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū senāsanacārikaṃ āhiṇḍantā yena tassa bhikkhuno vihāro tenupasaṅkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.3.eng: Just then a number of monks who were walking about the dwellings came to the one belonging to this monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.4.pli: Addasa kho sā makkaṭī te bhikkhū dūratova āgacchante.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.4.eng: The female monkey saw those monks coming.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.5.pli: Disvāna yena te bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ purato kaṭimpi cālesi cheppampi cālesi, kaṭimpi oḍḍi, nimittampi akāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.5.eng: She went up to them, shook her buttocks in front of them, wagged her tail, presented her backside, and made a gesture.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.6.pli: Atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi—“nissaṃsayaṃ kho so bhikkhu imissā makkaṭiyā methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevatī”ti. Ekamantaṃ nilīyiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.6.eng: The monks thought, “This monk must be having sexual intercourse with this monkey,” and they hid to one side.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.7.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu vesāliyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā piṇḍapātaṃ ādāya paṭikkami.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.7.eng: Then, when that monk had finished his almsround in Vesālī and had returned with his almsfood,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.8.pli: Atha kho sā makkaṭī yena so bhikkhu tenupasaṅkami.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.9.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu taṃ piṇḍapātaṃ ekadesaṃ bhuñjitvā ekadesaṃ tassā makkaṭiyā adāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.9.eng: he ate one part himself and gave the rest to that female monkey.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.10.pli: Atha kho sā makkaṭī taṃ piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjitvā tassa bhikkhuno kaṭiṃ oḍḍi. Atha kho so bhikkhu tassā makkaṭiyā methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.10.eng: After eating the food, the monkey presented her buttocks to the monk, and he had sexual intercourse with her.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.11.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavocuṃ—“nanu, āvuso, bhagavatā sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.11.eng: The other monks said to him, “Hasn’t a training rule been laid down by the Buddha?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.12.pli: kissa tvaṃ, āvuso, makkaṭiyā methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.12.eng: Why then do you have sexual intercourse with a monkey?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.13.pli: “Saccaṃ, āvuso, bhagavatā sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ; tañca kho manussitthiyā, no tiracchānagatāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.13.eng: “It’s true that a training rule has been laid down by the Buddha, but it concerns women, not animals.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.15.pli: Ananucchavikaṃ, āvuso, ananulomikaṃ appaṭirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.15.eng: It’s not suitable, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.16.pli: Kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, āvuso, evaṃ svākkhāte dhammavinaye pabbajitvā na sakkhissasi yāvajīvaṃ paripuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.16.eng: How could you go forth on such a well-proclaimed spiritual path and not be able to practice the perfectly complete and pure spiritual life to the end?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.17.pli: Nanu, āvuso, bhagavatā anekapariyāyena virāgāya dhammo desito, no sarāgāya …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.17.eng: Hasn’t the Buddha given many teachings for the sake of dispassion …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.18.eng: the stilling of the fevers of worldly pleasures?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.19.pli: Netaṃ, āvuso, appasannānaṃ vā pasādāya pasannānaṃ vā bhiyyobhāvāya.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.20.pli: Atha khvetaṃ, āvuso, appasannānañceva appasādāya, pasannānañca ekaccānaṃ aññathattāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.20.eng: and cause some to lose it.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.21.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū taṃ bhikkhuṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.21.eng: After rebuking that monk in many ways, they told the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.22.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.22.eng: The Buddha then had the Sangha of monks gathered and questioned that monk:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.23.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, bhikkhu, makkaṭiyā methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.23.eng: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.26.pli: “ananucchavikaṃ, moghapurisa, ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.26.eng: “Foolish man, it’s not suitable, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.27.pli: Kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, evaṃ svākkhāte dhammavinaye pabbajitvā na sakkhissasi yāvajīvaṃ paripuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.27.eng: How could you go forth on such a well-proclaimed spiritual path and not be able to practice the perfectly complete and pure spiritual life to the end?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.28.pli: Nanu mayā, moghapurisa, anekapariyāyena virāgāya dhammo desito, no sarāgāya …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.28.eng: Haven’t I given many teachings for the sake of dispassion …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.29.eng: for the stilling of the fevers of worldly desire?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.30.pli: Varaṃ te, moghapurisa, āsivisassa ghoravisassa mukhe aṅgajātaṃ pakkhittaṃ, na tveva makkaṭiyā aṅgajāte aṅgajātaṃ pakkhittaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.30.eng: It would be better, foolish man, for your penis to enter the mouth of a highly venomous snake than to enter a female monkey.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.31.pli: Varaṃ te, moghapurisa, kaṇhasappassa mukhe aṅgajātaṃ pakkhittaṃ, na tveva makkaṭiyā aṅgajāte aṅgajātaṃ pakkhittaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.31.eng: It would be better for your penis to enter the mouth of a black snake than to enter a female monkey.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.32.pli: Varaṃ te, moghapurisa, aṅgārakāsuyā ādittāya sampajjalitāya sajotibhūtāya aṅgajātaṃ pakkhittaṃ, na tveva makkaṭiyā aṅgajāte aṅgajātaṃ pakkhittaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.32.eng: It would be better for your penis to enter a blazing charcoal pit than to enter a female monkey.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.34.pli: Tatonidānañhi, moghapurisa, maraṇaṃ vā nigaccheyya maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhaṃ;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.34.eng: For although it might cause death or death-like suffering,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.35.pli: na tveva tappaccayā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjeyya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.35.eng: it would not cause you to be reborn in a bad destination.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.36.pli: Itonidānañca kho, moghapurisa, kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjeyya.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.37.pli: Tattha nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, yaṃ tvaṃ asaddhammaṃ gāmadhammaṃ vasaladhammaṃ duṭṭhullaṃ odakantikaṃ rahassaṃ dvayaṃdvayasamāpattiṃ samāpajjissasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.37.eng: Foolish man, you’ve practiced what is contrary to the true Teaching, the common practice, the low practice, the coarse practice, that which ends with a wash, that which is done in private, that which is done wherever there are couples.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.39.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.39.eng: “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.40.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭiseveyya antamaso tiracchānagatāyapi, pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.40.1.eng: ‘If a monk has sexual intercourse, even with a female animal, he is expelled and excluded from the community.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.41.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.41.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:6.42.eng: The account of the female monkey is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.0.eng: Third sub-story: the section for recitation on covering

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā vesālikā vajjiputtakā bhikkhū yāvadatthaṃ bhuñjiṃsu, yāvadatthaṃ supiṃsu, yāvadatthaṃ nhāyiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.1.eng: Soon afterwards there were a number of Vajjian monks from Vesālī who ate, slept, and bathed as much as they liked.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.2.pli: Yāvadatthaṃ bhuñjitvā yāvadatthaṃ supitvā yāvadatthaṃ nhāyitvā ayoniso manasi karitvā sikkhaṃ apaccakkhāya dubbalyaṃ anāvikatvā methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭiseviṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.2.eng: Then, not reflecting properly and without first renouncing the training and revealing their weakness, they had sexual intercourse.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.3.pli: Te aparena samayena ñātibyasanenapi phuṭṭhā bhogabyasanenapi phuṭṭhā rogabyasanenapi phuṭṭhā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadanti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.3.eng: After some time they were affected by loss of relatives, loss of property, and loss of health. They then went to Venerable Ānanda and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.4.pli: “na mayaṃ, bhante ānanda, buddhagarahino na dhammagarahino na saṅghagarahino;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.4.eng: “Venerable Ānanda, we don’t blame the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.5.eng: we only have ourselves to blame.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.6.eng: We were unfortunate and had little merit—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.7.pli: ye mayaṃ evaṃ svākkhāte dhammavinaye pabbajitvā nāsakkhimhā yāvajīvaṃ paripuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.7.eng: after going forth on such a well-proclaimed spiritual path, we were unable to practice the perfectly complete and pure spiritual life to the end.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.8.pli: Idāni cepi mayaṃ, bhante ānanda, labheyyāma bhagavato santike pabbajjaṃ labheyyāma upasampadaṃ, idānipi mayaṃ vipassakā kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pubbarattāpararattaṃ bodhipakkhikānaṃ dhammānaṃ bhāvanānuyogamanuyuttā vihareyyāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.8.eng: If we were now to get the going forth and the full ordination in the presence of the Buddha, we would have clarity about wholesome qualities and be devoted day in and day out to developing the aids to awakening.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.9.pli: Sādhu, bhante ānanda, bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocehī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.9.eng: Venerable Ānanda, please inform the Buddha.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.10.pli: “Evamāvuso”ti kho āyasmā ānando vesālikānaṃ vajjiputtakānaṃ paṭissuṇitvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.10.eng: Saying, “Yes,” he went to the Buddha and told him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.11.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, ānanda, anavakāso yaṃ tathāgato vajjīnaṃ vā vajjiputtakānaṃ vā kāraṇā sāvakānaṃ pārājikaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ samūhaneyyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.11.eng: “It’s impossible, Ānanda, that the Buddha should abolish a training rule that entails expulsion because of the Vajjians.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.12.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.12.eng: The Buddha then gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.13.pli: “yo, bhikkhave, sikkhaṃ apaccakkhāya dubbalyaṃ anāvikatvā methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevati so āgato na upasampādetabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.13.eng: “Monks, if someone, without first renouncing the training and revealing their weakness, has sexual intercourse, they may not receive the full ordination once again.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.14.pli: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya dubbalyaṃ āvikatvā methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevati so āgato upasampādetabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.14.eng: But, monks, if someone has sexual intercourse after first renouncing the training and revealing their weakness, they may receive the full ordination once again.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.15.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.15.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.16.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno sikkhaṃ apaccakkhāya dubbalyaṃ anāvikatvā methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭiseveyya, antamaso tiracchānagatāyapi, pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.16.1.eng: ‘If a monk, after taking on the monks’ training and way of life, without first renouncing the training and revealing his weakness, has sexual intercourse, even with a female animal, he is expelled and excluded from the community.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:7.1.16.1.comm: Paccakkhāya from paccakkhāti means to “speak against” or “renounce verbally”. To avoid clunkiness, I normally render this as “renounce”, except where the context requires the more complete formulation.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.1.2.pli: yo yādiso yathāyutto yathājacco yathānāmo yathāgotto yathāsīlo yathāvihārī yathāgocaro thero vā navo vā majjhimo vā. Eso vuccati “yo panā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.1.2.eng: whoever, of such a kind, of such activity, of such caste, of such name, of such family, of such conduct, of such behavior, of such association, who is senior, who is junior, or who is of middle standing—this is called “a”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.1.4.eng: he is a monk because he lives on alms;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.1.5.eng: a monk because he has gone over to living on alms;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.1.6.eng: a monk because he wears a patchwork cloth;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.1.8.eng: a monk on account of his claim;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.1.10.eng: a monk given the full ordination by taking the three refuges;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.1.15.pli: samaggena saṅghena ñatticatutthena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena upasampannoti bhikkhu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.1.15.eng: a monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.1.15.comm: “Irreversible” renders akuppa. See kuppa in Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.1.16.pli: Tatra yvāyaṃ bhikkhu samaggena saṅghena ñatticatutthena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena upasampanno, ayaṃ imasmiṃ atthe adhippeto bhikkhūti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.1.16.eng: The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.1.18.eng: the three trainings: the training in the higher morality, the training in the higher mind, the training in the higher wisdom.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.1.19.pli: Tatra yāyaṃ adhisīlasikkhā, ayaṃ imasmiṃ atthe adhippetā sikkhāti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.1.19.eng: The training in the higher morality is the training meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.1.21.pli: yaṃ bhagavatā paññattaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ, etaṃ sājīvaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.1.21.eng: whatever training rule has been laid down by the Buddha—this is called “way of life”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.1.22.eng: One trains in this; therefore it is called “after taking on the way of life”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.1.eng: Without first renouncing the training and revealing his weakness:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.2.pli: atthi, bhikkhave, dubbalyāvikammañceva hoti sikkhā ca apaccakkhātā;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.2.eng: “There is, monks, a revealing of weakness without the training being renounced;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.3.pli: atthi, bhikkhave, dubbalyāvikammañceva hoti sikkhā ca paccakkhātā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.3.eng: and there is a revealing of weakness together with the training being renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.4.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, dubbalyāvikammañceva hoti sikkhā ca apaccakkhātā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.4.eng: And how is there a revealing of weakness without the training being renounced?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.5.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ukkaṇṭhito anabhirato sāmaññā cavitukāmo
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.5.eng: It may be that a monk is dissatisfied, discontent, desiring to give up the monastic life;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.6.eng: troubled, ashamed, and disgusted with the monkhood;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.8.eng: longing to be a lay follower,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.9.eng: longing to be a monastery worker,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.11.eng: longing to be a monastic of another religion,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.12.eng: longing to be a lay follower of another religion,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.15.eng: and he says and declares: ‘Why don’t I renounce the Buddha?’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.16.pli: Evampi, bhikkhave, dubbalyāvikammañceva hoti sikkhā ca apaccakkhātā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.16.eng: In this way, monks, there’s a revealing of weakness without the training being renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.17.pli: Atha vā pana ukkaṇṭhito anabhirato sāmaññā cavitukāmo
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.17.eng: Or again, dissatisfied, discontent, desiring to give up the monastic life;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.18.eng: troubled, ashamed, and disgusted with the monkhood;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.21.eng: he says and declares: ‘Why don’t I renounce the Teaching?’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.33.eng: he says and declares: ‘Why don’t I renounce my fellow monastics?’ …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.33.comm: Here and in the next segment I have added ellipses points at the end. These ellipses points seem to have been omitted by mistake from the Pali.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.35.eng: ‘Why don’t I become a lay follower?’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.36.eng: ‘Why don’t I become a monastery worker?’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.38.eng: ‘Why don’t I become a monastic of another religion?’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.39.eng: ‘Why don’t I become a lay follower of another religion?’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.42.pli: Evampi, bhikkhave, dubbalyāvikammañceva hoti sikkhā ca apaccakkhātā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.42.eng: In this way too, monks, there’s a revealing of weakness without the training being renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.43.pli: Atha vā pana ukkaṇṭhito anabhirato sāmaññā cavitukāmo
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.43.eng: Or again, dissatisfied, discontent, desiring to give up the monastic life;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.44.eng: troubled, ashamed, and disgusted with the monkhood;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.47.eng: he says and declares: ‘What if I renounced the Buddha?’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.48.eng: he says and declares: ‘What if I were a non-monastic?’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.49.eng: he says and declares: ‘Perhaps I should renounce the Buddha?’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.50.eng: he says and declares: ‘Perhaps I should be a non-monastic?’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.51.eng: he says and declares: ‘Well then, I should renounce the Buddha.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.52.eng: he says and declares: ‘Well then, I should be a non-monastic.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.53.eng: he says and declares: ‘I think I should renounce the Buddha.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.54.eng: he says and declares: ‘I think I should be a non-monastic.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.55.pli: Evampi, bhikkhave, dubbalyāvikammañceva hoti sikkhā ca apaccakkhātā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.55.eng: In this way too, monks, there’s a revealing of weakness without the training being renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.56.pli: Atha vā pana ukkaṇṭhito anabhirato sāmaññā cavitukāmo
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.56.eng: Or again, dissatisfied, discontent, desiring to give up the monastic life;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.57.eng: troubled, ashamed, and disgusted with the monkhood;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.60.eng: he says and declares: ‘I remember my mother.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.76.pli: “pubbe hasitaṃ lapitaṃ kīḷitaṃ samanussarāmī”ti vadati viññāpeti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.76.eng: he says and declares: ‘I remember my former laughter, chatter, and play.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.77.pli: Evampi, bhikkhave, dubbalyāvikammañceva hoti sikkhā ca apaccakkhātā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.77.eng: In this way too, monks, there’s a revealing of weakness without the training being renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.78.pli: Atha vā pana ukkaṇṭhito anabhirato sāmaññā cavitukāmo
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.78.eng: Or again, dissatisfied, discontent, desiring to give up the monastic life;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.79.eng: troubled, ashamed, and disgusted with the monkhood;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.82.pli: “mātā me atthi, sā mayā posetabbā”ti vadati viññāpeti …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.82.eng: he says and declares: ‘I have a mother who should be supported by me.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.83.pli: “pitā me atthi, so mayā posetabbo”ti vadati viññāpeti …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.84.pli: “bhātā me atthi, so mayā posetabbo”ti vadati viññāpeti …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.85.pli: “bhaginī me atthi, sā mayā posetabbā”ti vadati viññāpeti …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.86.pli: “putto me atthi, so mayā posetabbo”ti vadati viññāpeti …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.87.pli: “dhītā me atthi, sā mayā posetabbā”ti vadati viññāpeti …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.88.pli: “pajāpati me atthi, sā mayā posetabbā”ti vadati viññāpeti …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.89.pli: “ñātakā me atthi, te mayā posetabbā”ti vadati viññāpeti …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.90.pli: “mittā me atthi, te mayā posetabbā”ti vadati viññāpeti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.90.eng: he says and declares: ‘I have friends who should be supported by me.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.91.pli: Evampi, bhikkhave, dubbalyāvikammañceva hoti sikkhā ca apaccakkhātā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.91.eng: In this way too, monks, there’s a revealing of weakness without the training being renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.92.pli: Atha vā pana ukkaṇṭhito anabhirato sāmaññā cavitukāmo
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.92.eng: Or again, dissatisfied, discontent, desiring to give up the monastic life;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.93.eng: troubled, ashamed, and disgusted with the monkhood;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.96.pli: “mātā me atthi, sā maṃ posessatī”ti vadati viññāpeti …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.96.eng: he says and declares: ‘I have a mother; she’ll support me.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.97.pli: “pitā me atthi, so maṃ posessatī”ti vadati viññāpeti …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.97.eng: ‘I have a father; he’ll support me.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.98.pli: “bhātā me atthi, so maṃ posessatī”ti vadati viññāpeti …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.98.eng: ‘I have a brother; he’ll support me.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.99.pli: “bhaginī me atthi, sā maṃ posessatī”ti vadati viññāpeti …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.99.eng: ‘I have a sister; she’ll support me.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.100.pli: “putto me atthi, so maṃ posessatī”ti vadati viññāpeti …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.100.eng: ‘I have a son; he’ll support me.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.101.pli: “dhītā me atthi, sā maṃ posessatī”ti vadati viññāpeti …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.101.eng: ‘I have a daughter; she’ll support me.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.102.pli: “pajāpati me atthi, sā maṃ posessatī”ti vadati viññāpeti …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.102.eng: ‘I have a wife; she’ll support me.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.103.pli: “ñātakā me atthi, te maṃ posessantī”ti vadati viññāpeti …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.104.pli: “mittā me atthi, te maṃ posessantī”ti vadati viññāpeti …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.105.pli: “gāmo me atthi, tenāhaṃ jīvissāmī”ti vadati viññāpeti …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.105.eng: ‘I have a village; I’ll live by means of it.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.106.pli: “nigamo me atthi, tenāhaṃ jīvissāmī”ti vadati viññāpeti …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.106.eng: ‘I have a town; I’ll live by means of it.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.107.pli: “khettaṃ me atthi, tenāhaṃ jīvissāmī”ti vadati viññāpeti …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.107.eng: ‘I have fields; I’ll live by means of them.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.108.pli: “vatthu me atthi, tenāhaṃ jīvissāmī”ti vadati viññāpeti …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.108.eng: ‘I have land; I’ll live by means of it.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.109.pli: “hiraññaṃ me atthi, tenāhaṃ jīvissāmī”ti vadati viññāpeti …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.109.eng: ‘I have money; I’ll live by means of it.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.110.pli: “suvaṇṇaṃ me atthi, tenāhaṃ jīvissāmī”ti vadati viññāpeti …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.110.eng: ‘I have gold; I’ll live by means of it.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.111.pli: “sippaṃ me atthi, tenāhaṃ jīvissāmī”ti vadati viññāpeti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.111.eng: he says and declares: ‘I have a profession; I’ll live by means of it.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.112.pli: Evampi, bhikkhave, dubbalyāvikammañceva hoti sikkhā ca apaccakkhātā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.112.eng: In this way too, monks, there’s a revealing of weakness without the training being renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.113.pli: Atha vā pana ukkaṇṭhito anabhirato sāmaññā cavitukāmo
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.113.eng: Or again, dissatisfied, discontent, desiring to give up the monastic life;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.114.eng: troubled, ashamed, and disgusted with the monkhood;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.117.eng: he says and declares: ‘This is difficult to do.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.125.pli: Evampi kho, bhikkhave, dubbalyāvikammañceva hoti sikkhā ca apaccakkhātā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.2.125.eng: In this way too, monks, there’s a revealing of weakness without the training being renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, dubbalyāvikammañceva hoti sikkhā ca paccakkhātā?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.1.eng: And how is there a revealing of weakness together with the training being renounced?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ukkaṇṭhito anabhirato sāmaññā cavitukāmo
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.2.eng: It may be that a monk is dissatisfied, discontent, desiring to give up the monastic life;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.3.eng: troubled, ashamed, and disgusted with the monkhood;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.5.eng: longing to be a non-monastic, and he says and declares:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.7.pli: Evampi, bhikkhave, dubbalyāvikammañceva hoti sikkhā ca paccakkhātā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.7.eng: In this way, monks, there’s a revealing of weakness together with the training being renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.8.pli: Atha vā pana ukkaṇṭhito anabhirato sāmaññā cavitukāmo
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.8.eng: Or again, dissatisfied, discontent, desiring to give up the monastic life;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.9.eng: troubled, ashamed, and disgusted with the monkhood;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.12.eng: he says and declares: ‘I renounce the Teaching.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.29.eng: ‘Consider me a monastic of another religion.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.30.eng: ‘Consider me a lay follower of another religion.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.33.pli: Evampi, bhikkhave, dubbalyāvikammañceva hoti sikkhā ca paccakkhātā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.33.eng: In this way too, monks, there’s a revealing of weakness together with the training being renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.34.pli: Atha vā pana ukkaṇṭhito anabhirato sāmaññā cavitukāmo
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.34.eng: Or again, dissatisfied, discontent, desiring to give up the monastic life;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.35.eng: troubled, ashamed, and disgusted with the monkhood;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.38.eng: he says and declares: ‘I’m done with the Buddha.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.40.eng: In this way too, monks, there’s a revealing of weakness together with the training being renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.42.eng: he says and declares: ‘No more of the Buddha for me.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.43.eng: ‘No more of my fellow monastics for me.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.44.eng: ‘The Buddha is of no use to me.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.45.eng: ‘My fellow monastics are of no use to me.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.47.eng: ‘I’m well freed from my fellow monastics.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.48.pli: Evampi, bhikkhave, dubbalyāvikammañceva hoti sikkhā ca paccakkhātā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.48.eng: In this way too, monks, there’s a revealing of weakness together with the training being renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.49.pli: Yāni vā panaññānipi atthi buddhavevacanāni vā dhammavevacanāni vā saṅghavevacanāni vā sikkhāvevacanāni vā vinayavevacanāni vā pātimokkhavevacanāni vā uddesavevacanāni vā upajjhāyavevacanāni vā ācariyavevacanāni vā saddhivihārikavevacanāni vā antevāsikavevacanāni vā samānupajjhāyakavevacanāni vā samānācariyakavevacanāni vā sabrahmacārivevacanāni vā gihivevacanāni vā upāsakavevacanāni vā ārāmikavevacanāni vā sāmaṇeravevacanāni vā titthiyavevacanāni vā titthiyasāvakavevacanāni vā assamaṇavevacanāni vā asakyaputtiyavevacanāni vā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.49.eng: Or whatever other synonyms there are for the Buddha, for the Teaching, for the Sangha, for the practice, for the training, for the Monastic Code, for the recitation, for a preceptor, for a teacher, for a student, for a pupil, for a co-student, for a co-pupil, for a fellow monastic, for a householder, for a lay follower, for a monastery worker, for a novice monk, for a monastic of another religion, for a lay follower of another religion, for a non-ascetic, or for a non-monastic—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.50.pli: tehi ākārehi tehi liṅgehi tehi nimittehi vadati viññāpeti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.50.eng: he speaks and declares by way of these indications, by way of these marks, by way of these signs.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.51.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, dubbalyāvikammañceva hoti sikkhā ca paccakkhātā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.3.51.eng: In this way, monks, there’s a revealing of weakness together with the training being renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.1.eng: And how is the training not renounced?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, yehi ākārehi yehi liṅgehi yehi nimittehi sikkhā paccakkhātā hoti tehi ākārehi tehi liṅgehi tehi nimittehi ummattako sikkhaṃ paccakkhāti, apaccakkhātā hoti sikkhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.2.eng: If you renounce the training by way of these indications, by way of these marks, by way of these signs, but you’re insane, then the training isn’t renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.3.pli: Ummattakassa santike sikkhaṃ paccakkhāti, apaccakkhātā hoti sikkhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.3.eng: If you renounce the training to one who’s insane, the training isn’t renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.4.pli: Khittacitto sikkhaṃ paccakkhāti, apaccakkhātā hoti sikkhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.4.eng: If you renounce the training when you’re deranged, the training isn’t renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.5.pli: Khittacittassa santike sikkhaṃ paccakkhāti, apaccakkhātā hoti sikkhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.5.eng: If you renounce the training to one who’s deranged, the training isn’t renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.6.pli: Vedanāṭṭo sikkhaṃ paccakkhāti, apaccakkhātā hoti sikkhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.6.eng: If you renounce the training when you’re overwhelmed by pain, the training isn’t renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.7.pli: Vedanāṭṭassa santike sikkhaṃ paccakkhāti, apaccakkhātā hoti sikkhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.7.eng: If you renounce the training to one who’s overwhelmed by pain, the training isn’t renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.8.pli: Devatāya santike sikkhaṃ paccakkhāti, apaccakkhātā hoti sikkhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.8.eng: If you renounce the training to a god, the training isn’t renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.9.pli: Tiracchānagatassa santike sikkhaṃ paccakkhāti, apaccakkhātā hoti sikkhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.9.eng: If you renounce the training to an animal, the training isn’t renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.10.pli: Ariyakena milakkhassa santike sikkhaṃ paccakkhāti, so ca na paṭivijānāti, apaccakkhātā hoti sikkhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.10.eng: If an Indo-Aryan renounces the training to a non-Indo-Aryan who doesn’t understand, the training isn’t renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.11.pli: Milakkhakena ariyassa santike sikkhaṃ paccakkhāti, so ca na paṭivijānāti, apaccakkhātā hoti sikkhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.11.eng: If a non-Indo-Aryan renounces the training to an Indo-Aryan who doesn’t understand, the training isn’t renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.12.pli: Ariyakena ariyassa santike sikkhaṃ paccakkhāti, so ca na paṭivijānāti, apaccakkhātā hoti sikkhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.12.eng: If an Indo-Aryan renounces the training to an Indo-Aryan who doesn’t understand, the training isn’t renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.13.pli: Milakkhakena milakkhassa santike sikkhaṃ paccakkhāti, so ca na paṭivijānāti, apaccakkhātā hoti sikkhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.13.eng: If a non-Indo-Aryan renounces the training to a non-Indo-Aryan who doesn’t understand, the training isn’t renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.14.pli: Davāya sikkhaṃ paccakkhāti, apaccakkhātā hoti sikkhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.14.eng: If you renounce the training as a joke, the training isn’t renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.15.pli: Ravāya sikkhaṃ paccakkhāti, apaccakkhātā hoti sikkhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.15.eng: If you renounce the training because of speaking too fast, the training isn’t renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.16.eng: If you announce what you don’t wish to announce, the training isn’t renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.17.pli: Sāvetukāmo na sāveti, apaccakkhātā hoti sikkhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.17.eng: If you don’t announce what you wish to announce, the training isn’t renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.18.eng: If you announce to one who doesn’t understand, the training isn’t renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.19.pli: Viññussa na sāveti, apaccakkhātā hoti sikkhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.19.eng: If you don’t announce to one who understands, the training isn’t renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.20.pli: Sabbaso vā pana na sāveti, apaccakkhātā hoti sikkhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.20.eng: Or if you don’t make a full announcement, the training isn’t renounced.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.21.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, apaccakkhātā hoti sikkhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.4.21.eng: In this way, monks, the training isn’t renounced.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.5.2.pli: yo so asaddhammo gāmadhammo vasaladhammo duṭṭhullaṃ odakantikaṃ rahassaṃ dvayaṃdvayasamāpatti, eso methunadhammo nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.5.2.eng: what is contrary to the true Teaching, the common practice, the low practice, the coarse practice, that which ends with a wash, that which is done in private, that which is done wherever there are couples—this is called “sexual intercourse”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.5.4.pli: yo nimittena nimittaṃ aṅgajātena aṅgajātaṃ antamaso tilaphalamattampi paveseti, eso paṭisevati nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.5.4.eng: whoever makes an organ enter an organ, a genital enter a genital, even to the depth of a sesame seed—this is called “has”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.5.6.pli: tiracchānagatitthiyāpi methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevitvā assamaṇo hoti asakyaputtiyo, pageva manussitthiyā. Tena vuccati— “antamaso tiracchānagatāyapī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.5.6.eng: even having had sexual intercourse with a female animal, he is not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic, let alone with a woman—therefore it is called “even with a female animal”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.5.8.pli: seyyathāpi nāma puriso sīsacchinno abhabbo tena sarīrabandhanena jīvituṃ; evameva bhikkhu methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevitvā assamaṇo hoti asakyaputtiyo. Tena vuccati— “pārājiko hotī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.5.8.eng: just as a man with his head cut off is unable to continue living by reconnecting it to the body, so too is a monk who has had sexual intercourse not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic. Therefore it is said, “he is expelled.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.5.10.pli: saṃvāso nāma ekakammaṃ ekuddeso samasikkhatā— eso saṃvāso nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.5.10.eng: Community: joint legal procedures, a joint recitation, the same training—this is called “community”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.5.11.pli: So tena saddhiṃ natthi. Tena vuccati—“asaṃvāso”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:8.5.11.eng: He does not take part in this—therefore it is called “excluded from the community”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.1.1.eng: There are three kinds of females:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.1.2.eng: a female human being, a female spirit, a female animal.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.1.3.eng: There are three kinds of hermaphrodites:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.1.4.eng: a human hermaphrodite, a hermaphrodite spirit, a hermaphrodite animal.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.1.4.comm: “Gynandromorph” renders ubhatobyañjanaka. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.1.5.eng: There are three kinds of paṇḍakas:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.1.6.eng: a human paṇḍaka, a paṇḍaka spirit, a paṇḍaka animal.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.1.6.comm: For the meaning of the term paṇḍaka, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.1.7.eng: There are three kinds of males:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.1.8.eng: a human male, a male spirit, a male animal.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.1.9.1.pli: Manussitthiyā tayo magge methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevantassa āpatti pārājikassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.1.9.1.eng: He commits an offense entailing expulsion if he has sexual intercourse with a female human being through three orifices:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.1.10.eng: the anus, the vagina, or the mouth. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.1.12.pli: tiracchānagatitthiyā tayo magge methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevantassa āpatti pārājikassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.1.12.eng: He commits an offense entailing expulsion if he has sexual intercourse with a female animal through three orifices:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.1.13.eng: the anus, the vagina, or the mouth. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.1.16.pli: tiracchānagatubhatobyañjanakassa tayo magge methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevantassa āpatti pārājikassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.1.16.eng: He commits an offense entailing expulsion if he has sexual intercourse with a hermaphrodite animal through three orifices:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.1.17.eng: the anus, the vagina, or the mouth.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.1.18.pli: Manussapaṇḍakassa dve magge methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevantassa āpatti pārājikassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.1.18.eng: He commits an offense entailing expulsion if he has sexual intercourse with a human paṇḍaka through two orifices:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.1.24.pli: tiracchānagatapurisassa dve magge methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevantassa āpatti pārājikassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.1.24.eng: He commits an offense entailing expulsion if he has sexual intercourse with a male animal through two orifices:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.2.1.pli: Bhikkhussa sevanacittaṃ upaṭṭhite manussitthiyā vaccamaggaṃ aṅgajātaṃ pavesentassa āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.2.1.eng: If a monk has the intention of sexual relations and he makes his penis enter the anus of a female human being …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.2.1.comm: “Intention of sexual relations” renders sevanacitta, literally, “intention of association”. The kind of association applicable to this rule, however, is sexual intercourse.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.2.2.eng: the vagina of a female human being …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.2.3.eng: the mouth of a female human being, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.2.4.eng: If a monk has the intention of sexual relations and he makes his penis enter the anus of a female spirit …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.2.5.eng: the anus of a female animal …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.2.6.eng: the anus of a human hermaphrodite …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.2.7.eng: the anus of a hermaphrodite spirit …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.2.8.eng: the anus of a hermaphrodite animal

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.2.9.pli: vaccamaggaṃ passāvamaggaṃ mukhaṃ aṅgajātaṃ pavesentassa āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.2.9.eng: … the vagina of a hermaphrodite animal … the mouth of a hermaphrodite animal, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.2.10.pli: Bhikkhussa sevanacittaṃ upaṭṭhite manussapaṇḍakassa vaccamaggaṃ mukhaṃ aṅgajātaṃ pavesentassa āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.2.10.eng: If a monk has the intention of sexual relations and he makes his penis enter the anus of a human paṇḍaka …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.2.11.eng: the anus of a paṇḍaka spirit …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.2.12.eng: the anus of a paṇḍaka animal …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.2.13.eng: the anus of a human male …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.2.14.eng: the anus of a male spirit …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.2.15.pli: tiracchānagatapurisassa vaccamaggaṃ mukhaṃ aṅgajātaṃ pavesentassa āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.2.15.eng: the anus of a male animal … the mouth of a male animal, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.0.eng: Forced sexual intercourse: bringing the partner to the monk

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.1.pli: Bhikkhupaccatthikā manussitthiṃ bhikkhussa santike ānetvā vaccamaggena aṅgajātaṃ abhinisīdenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.1.eng: Enemy monks bring a female human being to a monk and make her sit down so that his penis enters her anus.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.1.comm: “Enemy monks” renders bhikkhupaccatthikā, translated as “opponents of monks” by I. B. Horner, which seems to be incorrect. Below we find parallel compounds with other kinds of people, for instance corapaccatthikā, which in the context must mean “enemy criminals”, not “enemies of criminals”. Moreover, all these other people would already be accounted for if bhikkhupaccatthikā meant “enemies of monks”. There would be no need to mention them separately.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.2.pli: So ce pavesanaṃ sādiyati, paviṭṭhaṃ sādiyati, ṭhitaṃ sādiyati, uddharaṇaṃ sādiyati, āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.2.eng: If he consents to the entry, and he consents to having entered, and he consents to the remaining, and he consents to the taking out, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.2.comm: That is, he consents to the sexual intercourse at each of these points.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.3.pli: Bhikkhupaccatthikā manussitthiṃ bhikkhussa santike ānetvā vaccamaggena aṅgajātaṃ abhinisīdenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.3.eng: Enemy monks bring a female human being to a monk and make her sit down so that his penis enters her anus.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.4.pli: So ce pavesanaṃ na sādiyati, paviṭṭhaṃ sādiyati, ṭhitaṃ sādiyati, uddharaṇaṃ sādiyati, āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.4.eng: If he does not consent to the entry, but he consents to having entered, and he consents to the remaining, and he consents to the taking out, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.5.pli: Bhikkhupaccatthikā manussitthiṃ bhikkhussa santike ānetvā vaccamaggena aṅgajātaṃ abhinisīdenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.5.eng: Enemy monks bring a female human being to a monk and make her sit down so that his penis enters her anus.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.6.pli: So ce pavesanaṃ na sādiyati, paviṭṭhaṃ na sādiyati, ṭhitaṃ sādiyati, uddharaṇaṃ sādiyati, āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.6.eng: If he does not consent to the entry, nor to having entered, but he consents to the remaining, and he consents to the taking out, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.7.pli: Bhikkhupaccatthikā manussitthiṃ bhikkhussa santike ānetvā vaccamaggena aṅgajātaṃ abhinisīdenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.7.eng: Enemy monks bring a female human being to a monk and make her sit down so that his penis enters her anus.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.8.pli: So ce pavesanaṃ na sādiyati, paviṭṭhaṃ na sādiyati, ṭhitaṃ na sādiyati, uddharaṇaṃ sādiyati, āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.8.eng: If he does not consent to the entry, nor to having entered, nor to the remaining, but he consents to the taking out, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.9.pli: Bhikkhupaccatthikā manussitthiṃ bhikkhussa santike ānetvā vaccamaggena aṅgajātaṃ abhinisīdenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.9.eng: Enemy monks bring a female human being to a monk and make her sit down so that his penis enters her anus.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.10.pli: So ce pavesanaṃ na sādiyati, paviṭṭhaṃ na sādiyati, ṭhitaṃ na sādiyati, uddharaṇaṃ na sādiyati, anāpatti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.10.eng: If he does not consent to the entry, nor to having entered, nor to the remaining, nor to the taking out, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.11.pli: Bhikkhupaccatthikā manussitthiṃ bhikkhussa santike ānetvā passāvamaggena …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.11.eng: Enemy monks bring a female human being to a monk and make her sit down so that his penis enters her vagina …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.13.eng: If he consents to the entry, and he consents to having entered, and he consents to the remaining, and he consents to the taking out, he commits an offense entailing expulsion. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.14.eng: If he does not consent to the entry, nor to having entered, nor to the remaining, nor to the taking out, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.15.eng: Enemy monks bring a female human being who is awake …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.22.eng: he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.23.pli: Mataṃ yebhuyyena khāyitaṃ bhikkhussa santike ānetvā vaccamaggena …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.23.eng: They bring one who is dead and mostly decomposed to a monk and make her sit down so that his penis enters her anus …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.26.pli: So ce pavesanaṃ sādiyati, paviṭṭhaṃ sādiyati, ṭhitaṃ sādiyati, uddharaṇaṃ sādiyati, āpatti thullaccayassa …pe…

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.27.eng: If he does not consent … there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.28.eng: Enemy monks bring a female spirit …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.67.eng: If he does not consent … there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.3.70.eng: a male animal to a monk and make it sit down so that his penis enters its anus …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.6.1.eng: Enemy monks bring a monk to a female human being and make him sit down so that his penis enters her anus …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.6.1.comm: The Pali phrase aṅgajātena vaccamaggaṁ abhinisīdenti could be rendered, “They make (the monk) sit down with his penis in the anus.” Above we find the inverse expression, vaccamaggena aṅgajātaṁ abhinisīdenti, which could be rendered, “They make (the woman) sit on his penis with her anus.” The effect is the same, but the agent in the two cases is different. Since the agent is clear from the context, I have rendered the two expressions in the same way.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.1.eng: As “enemy monks” has been explained in detail, so should the following categories be explained:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.6.eng: The section in brief is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.7.1.eng: If he makes a private part enter a private part, there is an offense entailing expulsion.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.7.1.comm: For an explanation of the words magga and amagga as used here, see magga in Appendix of Technical Terms. In this section, as above, the instrumental case signifies the orifice that is entered. This may seem unusual, but it follows the pattern found elsewhere where the gateway through which anything (such as a house, a village, or a cul-de-sac) is entered is in the instrumental case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.8.eng: If he makes the mouth enter a private part, there is an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.9.eng: If he makes a private part enter the mouth, there is an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.10.eng: If he makes the mouth enter the mouth, there is a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.11.eng: A monk rapes a sleeping monk:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.12.eng: if he wakes up and consents, both should be expelled;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.12.comm: “Should be expelled” renders nāsetabbā. For a discussion of the verb nāseti, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.13.eng: if he wakes up but does not consent, the rapist should be expelled.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.13.comm: “Rapist” renders dūsaka. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.14.eng: A monk rapes a sleeping novice:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.15.eng: if he wakes up and consents, both should be expelled;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.16.eng: if he wakes up but does not consent, the rapist should be expelled.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.17.eng: A novice rapes a sleeping monk:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.18.eng: if he wakes up and consents, both should be expelled;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.19.eng: if he wakes up but does not consent, the rapist should be expelled.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.20.eng: A novice rapes a sleeping novice:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.21.eng: if he wakes up and consents, both should be expelled;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.22.eng: if he wakes up but does not consent, the rapist should be expelled.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.28.eng: if he is overwhelmed by pain;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.29.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.30.eng: The section for recitation on covering is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.33.eng: Householder, and a naked one, monastics of other religions;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.38.eng: Two on wounds, and a picture,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.42.eng: A female dragon, and a female spirit, and a female ghost,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.43.eng: A paṇḍaka, impaired, should touch.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.44.eng: The sleeping Perfected One in Bhaddiya,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.47.eng: The one from Bharukaccha in his dream.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.49.eng: A trainee nun, and a novice nun;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.50.eng: A sex worker, a paṇḍaka, a female householder,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:9.7.51.eng: Each other, gone forth in old age, a deer.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu makkaṭiyā methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.1.1.eng: At one time a monk had sexual intercourse with a female monkey.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.1.3.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a training rule.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.1.4.pli: kacci nu kho ahaṃ pārājikaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.1.4.eng: Could it be that I’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā vesālikā vajjiputtakā bhikkhū sikkhaṃ apaccakkhāya dubbalyaṃ anāvikatvā methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭiseviṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.2.1.eng: At one time a number of Vajjian monks from Vesālī had sexual intercourse without first renouncing the training and revealing their weakness.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.2.3.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a training rule.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.20.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu vesāliyaṃ mahāvane divāvihāragato rukkhaṃ apassāya nipanno hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.20.1.eng: At one time a monk went to the Great Wood at Vesālī for the day’s meditation. He lay down, resting his head against a tree.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.20.2.eng: A woman saw him and sat down on his penis.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.20.7.eng: “There’s no offense for one who doesn’t consent.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.20.8.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu vesāliyaṃ mahāvane divāvihāragato rukkhaṃ apassāya nipanno hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.20.8.eng: At one time a monk went to the Great Wood at Vesālī for the day’s meditation. He lay down, resting his head against a tree.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.20.9.eng: A woman saw him and sat down on his penis.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.20.14.eng: “There’s no offense for one who doesn’t consent.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.21.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu vesāliyaṃ mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ divāvihāragato dvāraṃ vivaritvā nipanno hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.21.1.eng: At one time a monk went to the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood near Vesālī for the day’s meditation. He opened the door, lay down,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.21.2.eng: and had an erection because of wind.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.21.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā itthiyo gandhañca mālañca ādāya ārāmaṃ āgamaṃsu vihārapekkhikāyo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.21.3.eng: Just then a number of women came to the monastery to look at the dwellings, bringing scents and garlands.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.21.4.pli: Atha kho tā itthiyo taṃ bhikkhuṃ passitvā aṅgajāte abhinisīditvā yāvadatthaṃ katvā, purisūsabho vatāyanti vatvā gandhañca mālañca āropetvā pakkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.21.4.eng: They saw that monk and sat down on his penis. Having taken their pleasure, they said, “What a bull of a man.” They then put up their scents and garlands and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.21.5.pli: Bhikkhū kilinnaṃ passitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.21.5.eng: The monks saw the moisture and told the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.21.6.eng: “Monks, an erection occurs for five reasons:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.21.7.eng: because of sensual desire, feces, urine, or wind, or because of being stung by caterpillars.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.21.8.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahākārehi aṅgajātaṃ kammaniyaṃ hoti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.21.9.pli: Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso, yaṃ tassa bhikkhuno rāgena aṅgajātaṃ kammaniyaṃ assa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.21.9.eng: It’s impossible that that monk had an erection because of sensual desire.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.21.10.eng: That monk is a perfected one.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.21.11.eng: There’s no offense for that monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.21.12.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, divā paṭisallīyantena dvāraṃ saṃvaritvā paṭisallīyitun”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.21.12.eng: But, monks, you should close the door when you are in seclusion during the day.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.21.12.comm: “Should” renders anujānāmi. See Appendix of Technical Terms for a discussion of this word.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.22.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhārukacchako bhikkhu supinante purāṇadutiyikāya methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevitvā—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.22.1.eng: At one time a monk from Bharukaccha dreamed that he had sexual intercourse with his ex-wife.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.22.2.eng: He thought he was no longer a monastic and that he would have to disrobe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.22.2.comm: “Disrobe” renders vibbhamissāmi. According to PED and SED the general meaning of this word is something like “to go astray”. However, the implied meaning throughout the Vinaya Piṭaka is that one leaves the Sangha, that is, one disrobes. I therefore take this word to express the functional equivalence of disrobing. This is supported by the commentaries. Sp 1.435: Vibbhamantīti ekacce gihī honti, “Vibbhamanti: some became householders.” Sp 4.434: Yadeva sā vibbhantāti yasmā sā vibbhantā attano ruciyā khantiyā odātāni vatthāni nivatthā, tasmāyeva sā abhikkhunī, na sikkhāpaccakkhānenāti dasseti, “Yadeva sā vibbhantā means she is no longer a nun because, according to her own preference and choice, she dresses in white.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.22.3.pli: bhārukacchaṃ gacchanto antarāmagge āyasmantaṃ upāliṃ passitvā etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.22.3.eng: While on his way to Bharukaccha, he saw Venerable Upāli and told him what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.22.5.eng: “There’s no offense when it occurs while dreaming.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.23.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rājagahe supabbā nāma upāsikā mudhappasannā hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.23.1.eng: At one time in Rājagaha there was a female lay follower called Supabbā who had misplaced faith.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.23.1.comm: Mudhappasannā is not directly defined in the commentaries, but we do find indications of its meaning. Sp-ṭ 1.165: Balavasaddho hi mandapañño mudhappasanno hoti, avatthusmiṁ pasīdati, “One who has strong faith and weak wisdom is called mudhappasanna. Their confidence is without basis.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.23.3.pli: “yā methunaṃ dhammaṃ deti sā aggadānaṃ detī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.23.3.eng: a woman who gives sexual intercourse gives the highest gift.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.23.4.eng: She saw a monk and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.23.8.eng: In this way there won’t be any offense for you. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.23.14.eng: Then rub against a coil of hair. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.23.16.eng: Then I’ll make you discharge with my hand.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.23.17.eng: In this way there won’t be any offense for you.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.23.21.eng: but there’s an offense entailing suspension.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.24.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sāvatthiyaṃ saddhā nāma upāsikā mudhappasannā hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.24.1.eng: At one time in Sāvatthī there was a female lay follower called Saddhā who had misplaced faith.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.24.3.pli: “yā methunaṃ dhammaṃ deti sā aggadānaṃ detī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.24.3.eng: a woman who gives sexual intercourse gives the highest gift.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.24.4.eng: She saw a monk and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.24.8.eng: Then I’ll make you discharge with my hand.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.24.9.eng: In this way there won’t be any offense for you.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.24.13.eng: but there’s an offense entailing suspension.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.25.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena vesāliyaṃ licchavikumārakā bhikkhuṃ gahetvā bhikkhuniyā vippaṭipādesuṃ …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.25.1.eng: At one time in Vesālī some Licchavī youths grabbed a monk and made him commit misconduct with a nun. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.25.2.eng: made him commit misconduct with a trainee nun. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.25.3.eng: made him commit misconduct with a novice nun.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.25.7.eng: there is no offense for either.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.25.8.pli: Tena kho pana samayena vesāliyaṃ licchavikumārakā bhikkhuṃ gahetvā vesiyā vippaṭipādesuṃ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.25.15.pli: Tena kho pana samayena vesāliyaṃ licchavikumārakā bhikkhū gahetvā aññamaññaṃ vippaṭipādesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.25.15.eng: At one time in Vesālī some Licchavī youths grabbed two monks and made them commit misconduct with each other.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.25.19.eng: there is no offense for either.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.26.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro vuḍḍhapabbajito bhikkhu purāṇadutiyikāya dassanaṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.26.1.eng: At one time a monk who had gone forth in old age went to see his ex-wife.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.26.2.eng: Saying, “Come and disrobe,” she grabbed him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.26.3.eng: Stepping backward, the monk fell on his back.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.26.4.eng: She pulled up his robe and sat down on his penis.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.26.8.eng: “There’s no offense for one who doesn’t consent.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.27.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu araññe viharati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.27.1.eng: At one time a certain monk was staying in the wilderness.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.27.2.pli: Migapotako tassa passāvaṭṭhānaṃ āgantvā passāvaṃ pivanto mukhena aṅgajātaṃ aggahesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.27.2.eng: A young deer came to his place of urination, drank the urine, and took hold of his penis with its mouth.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.27.6.eng: The first offense entailing expulsion is finished.
